Section Title: NOTICE TO AUSTRIAN INVESTORS
Subsection Title: PRESENTATION OF FINANCIAL AND OTHER INFORMATION General
Subsubsection Text: _The Issuers_ The Senior Secured Notes Issuer and the Senior Notes Issuer are public limited companies incorporated under the laws of England and Wales as private limited companies on September 3, 2020 and re-registered as public limited companies on December 18 and 21, 2020, respectively, for the purpose of consummating the Transactions. As of the date of this Offering Memorandum, the Issuers are holding companies with no revenue-generating activities of their own, and no business operations, material assets or liabilities other than those incurred in connection with their incorporation and the Transactions. As a result, no financial information of the Issuers is included in this Offering Memorandum. For further information, please see "Summary Corporate and Financing Structure," "Business" and "Description of Certain Financing Arrangements." _The Company_ All historical financial information presented in this Offering Memorandum is that of the Company. Accordingly, unless otherwise stated, all references to "ASDA," "we," "us," "our" or the "Company" in respect of historical financial information in this Offering Memorandum are to the Company and its subsidiaries, collectively. The Company is a private company limited by share capital incorporated under the laws of England and Wales on October 27, 1978. The financial information presented in this Offering Memorandum includes: - the audited consolidated financial statements of the Company as of and for the year ended December 31, 2017 prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards as adopted by the European Union ("IFRS") (the "2017 Financial Statements"); - the audited consolidated financial statements of the Company as of and for the year ended December 31, 2018 prepared in accordance with IFRS (the "2018 Financial Statements"); - the audited consolidated financial statements of the Company as of and for the year ended December 31, 2019 prepared in accordance with IFRS (the "2019 Financial Statements"); and - the unaudited condensed consolidated interim financial statements of the Company as of and for the nine months ended September 30, 2020 prepared in accordance with IAS 34 Interim Financial _Reporting as adopted by the European Union with comparable information as of December 31,_ 2019 and for the nine months ended September 30, 2019 (the "Unaudited Condensed

Section Title: NOTICE TO AUSTRIAN INVESTORS
Subsection Title: Consolidated Interim Financial Statements," and the 2017 Financial Statements, 2018 Financial
Subsubsection Text: Statements, 2019 Financial Statements and the Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial Statements collectively being the "Financial Statements"). The 2017 Financial Statements, the 2018 Financial Statements and the 2019 Financial Statements have been audited by Ernst & Young LLP, as set forth in their audit reports included elsewhere herein. Unless otherwise stated, no other financial information presented in this Offering Memorandum has been audited. The Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial Statements have been prepared in accordance with IAS 34 Interim Financial Reporting as adopted by the European Union. The Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial Statements do not include all notes of the type normally included in an annual financial report. The accounting policies adopted are consistent with those of the 2019 Financial Statements, except for the estimation of income tax expense, which has been recognised based on the estimate of the weighted average effective annual income tax rate expected for the full financial year, and the adoption of new and amended standards. This Offering Memorandum includes unaudited financial information for the 12 months ended September 30, 2020, which is calculated by adding the results of operations for the nine months ended September 30, 2020 to the results of operations for the year ended December 31, 2019 and subtracting the results of operations for the nine months ended September 30, 2019. The financial information for the 12 months ended September 30, 2020 is not necessarily indicative of the results of operations that may be expected for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2020 or any future period, and should not be used as the basis for or prediction of an annualised calculation. The unaudited financial information for the 12 months ended September 30, 2020 has not been audited or reviewed by our auditors, is not required by or presented in accordance with IFRS or any other generally accepted accounting principles and has been prepared for illustrative purposes only. 1 ----- In this Offering Memorandum we present certain financial information related to periods prior to 2017. The financial information for periods prior to 2017 has been presented herein for illustrative purposes only and investors should place no reliance on such information. This Offering Memorandum does not include the audited financial statements for any period prior to 2017. There can be no assurance that, had such information been audited or reviewed, there would not have been any discrepancies (including material) compared to the financial information presented herein. The financial information presented in this Offering Memorandum for periods prior to the year ended December 31, 2019 may not be comparable to financial information for later periods, due to changes that have occurred to IFRS that have occurred over time, in particular the significant changes caused by the adoption of IFRS 16 on January 1, 2019 as described below. The preparation of financial statements in conformity with IFRS requires the use of certain critical accounting estimates. It also requires management to exercise its judgment in the process of applying our accounting policies. The areas involving a higher degree of judgment or complexity, or areas where assumptions and estimates are significant to the financial statements, are disclosed in the Financial Statements. See "Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of _Operations—Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates."_ In making an investment decision, you must rely upon your own examination of the terms of this Offering and the financial information contained in this Offering Memorandum. Prospective investors should consult their professional advisors for an understanding of: (i) the differences between IFRS, generally accepted accounting principles in the United States of America ("U.S. GAAP"), UK GAAP and other systems of generally accepted accounting principles and how these differences might affect the financial information included in this Offering Memorandum, and (ii) the impact that future additions to, or amendments of IFRS principles may have on our results of operations and/or financial condition, as well as on the comparability of the prior periods. With respect to the 2019 Financial Statements, the Company applied the new IFRS 16 (Leases) accounting standard, effective from January 1, 2019, using the modified retrospective approach, as defined by the IFRS 16 accounting standard. The cumulative effects of applying this new accounting standard were therefore recognised as an adjustment to retained earnings as of January 1, 2019 (the date of initial application), while comparative figures were not restated. Additionally, previous lease-related balances including operating lease prepayments, onerous lease provisions and straight-line rent accruals have been derecognised as part of the Company's adoption of IFRS 16. The 2017 Financial Statements and the 2018 Financial Statements have not been restated for the adoption of IFRS 16 and thus cannot be directly compared to the 2019 Financial Statements, and the Company has not otherwise restated comparative amounts as of and for the years ended December 31, 2017 or 2018. IFRS 16 eliminates the classification of leases as either operating leases or finance leases for lessees and introduces a single lessee accounting model with some exemptions for short-term and low-value leases. The lessee recognises a right-of-use asset representing its right to use the underlying asset and a lease liability representing its obligation to make lease payments. The effect of applying IFRS 16 is to align the presentation of leases more closely to that of owned assets, rent expense is no longer deducted in arriving at operating profit or EBITDA and instead profit before tax includes an interest charge on the unwinding of the lease liability and a depreciation charge on the right of use asset. As a result of the adoption of IFRS 16, right of use assets of £2,263.9 million and additional lease liabilities of £1,979.4 million were recognised as of January 1, 2019, and operating costs decreased by £31.4 million and finance costs increased by £52.7 million compared with lease-related expenses charged in the prior year under IAS 17. See note 1 ("Accounting Policies") of the 2019 Financial Statements. For the avoidance of doubt, the historical financial information provided in this Offering Memorandum in relation to IFRS 16 does not reflect the potential impact of the Forecourt Assets Separation and the leases of the Select Retail Assets, the Substitute Retail Assets and the Distribution Assets. The financial information included in this Offering Memorandum is not intended to comply with the applicable accounting requirements of the U.S. Securities Act and the related rules and regulations of the SEC, which would apply if the Notes were being registered with the SEC. There could be significant differences between IFRS and U.S. GAAP, as applied to the Company. We neither describe the differences between IFRS and U.S. GAAP nor reconcile the Company's IFRS financial statements to U.S. GAAP. Accordingly, such information is not available to investors, and investors should consider this in making their investment decision. The Indentures will impose no obligation on us to reconcile the Company's future financial statements prepared under IFRS to U.S. GAAP. See "Independent Auditors" for a description of the independent auditors' reports of Ernst & Young LLP. In accordance with guidance issued by The Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales, the independent auditors' reports from Ernst & Young LLP for the fiscal years ended December 31, 2019, December 31, 2018 and December 31, 2017 state that Ernst & Young LLP does not assume responsibility 2 ----- to anyone (including holders of Notes) other than the Company, as a body, for its audit work or the audit reports or opinions it has formed. Ernst & Young LLP has undertaken its audit work, in accordance with Chapter 3 of Part 16 of the Companies Act 2006, to state to the Company's members those matters that it is required to state to them in an auditor's report and for no other purpose. Investors in the Notes should understand that in making these statements, the independent auditors have confirmed that they do not accept or assume any liability to parties (such as the purchasers of the Notes) other than to the Company and its members, as a body, with respect to the report and to the independent auditors' audit work and opinions. The SEC would not permit such limiting language to be included in a registration statement or a prospectus used in connection with an offering of securities registered under the U.S. Securities Act or in a report filed under the U.S. Exchange Act. If a U.S. court (or any other court) were to give effect to such limiting language, the recourse that investors in the Notes may have against the independent auditor based on its report or the consolidated financial statements to which it relates could be limited. See "Risk Factors—Risks Relating to Financial, Reporting and Other Matters— _The audit reports of Ernst & Young LLP included in this Offering Memorandum include statements purporting to limit the persons that may rely on such reports and the opinions contained therein."_

Section Title: NOTICE TO AUSTRIAN INVESTORS
Subsection Title: Unaudited Pro forma Adjusted Financial Information
Subsubsection Text: We present in this Offering Memorandum certain unaudited financial information adjusted to give pro _forma effect to the Transactions ("As Adjusted Financial Information"). See "Summary Historical Consolidated Financial Information and Other Financial Data—Other Financial Data—Other Financial Indicators" and "Capitalisation."_ The As Adjusted Financial Information included in this Offering Memorandum has not been prepared in accordance with the requirements of Regulation S-X of the U.S. Securities Act or any generally accepted accounting standards. The assumptions underlying the As Adjusted Financial Information have not been audited or reviewed in accordance with any generally accepted accounting standards. Any reliance you place on this information should fully take this into consideration. The As Adjusted Financial Information has been provided for informational purposes only. Results indicated by certain of these measures may not be realised, and funds depicted by certain of these measures may not be available for management's discretionary use if such results are not realised. Further, the As Adjusted Financial Information does not purport to indicate our future consolidated results of operations or our cash position or financial position as at any future date. The actual results may differ significantly from those reflected in the unaudited pro forma financial information for a number of reasons, including, but not limited to, differences in assumptions used to prepare the As Adjusted Financial Information. The As Adjusted Financial Information should be read in conjunction with the information contained in "Summary Historical Consolidated Financial Information and Other Financial Data," "Selected _Consolidated Financial Information," "Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations" and "Risk Factors" and the financial statements included in this Offering_ Memorandum.

Section Title: NOTICE TO AUSTRIAN INVESTORS
Subsection Title: Non-IFRS Financial Measures
Subsubsection Text: In this Offering Memorandum the Company presents certain financial measures that are not required by or presented in accordance with IFRS (the "Non-IFRS Measures"). The Non-IFRS Measures included in this Offering Memorandum do not alone provide a sufficient basis to compare the ASDA Group's performance with that of other companies and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for an equivalent IFRS measure (if applicable) or any other generally accepted measure as an indicator of operating performance or liquidity. Such non-IFRS financial information has not been audited or reviewed by Ernst & Young LLP. We believe that the presentation of the Non-IFRS Measures enhances an investor's understanding of our operating performance and our ability to service our debt. In addition, we believe that EBITDA is a measure commonly used by investors. The Company's Non-IFRS Measures may not be directly comparable with similarly titled measures used by other companies. The EBITDA Measures (as defined below) and related leverage and coverage ratios are not measurements of financial performance under IFRS and should not be considered as alternatives to other indicators of our operating performance, cash flows or any other measure of performance derived in accordance with IFRS. You are encouraged to evaluate each of the adjustments reflected in the Company's presentation of the Non-IFRS Measures and whether you consider each to be appropriate. In addition, each of the Non-IFRS Measures may be defined differently from the definitions of corresponding or similar terms under the Indentures. The Company's NonIFRS Measures have important limitations as analytical tools. Some limitations of the Non-IFRS Measures include: 3 ----- - they do not reflect the interest expense or cash requirements necessary to service interest or principal payments on the Company's debt; - they do not reflect any cash income and certain other taxes that the Company may be required to pay; - they are not adjusted for all cash income or expense items that are reflected in the Company's statements of cash flows; - they do not reflect the impact of earnings or charges resulting from certain matters the Company considers not to be indicative of its ongoing operations; - following the implementation of IFRS 16, they do not reflect any expense relating to leased assets classified as interest or depreciation; - in respect of Adjusted EBITDA, Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA and the other Non-IFRS Measures that reflect such measures, they reflect certain adjustments for anticipated cost savings, synergies and other estimates that may not be realised, whether in part or at all; and - they may not fully take into account the impact of COVID-19 on the Company's financial performance. Furthermore, you should carefully consider the risks and limitations of the Non-IFRS Measures, as they are based in part on assumptions made by the Company's management regarding the future impact of actions that have not yet been, and which may not in fact be, implemented. For example, there is a risk that the synergies we seek to achieve may not be realised in the anticipated time frame or at all and that the magnitude of cost savings may be significantly less than expected. Because of these limitations, our Non-IFRS Measures should not be considered as measures of discretionary cash available to us to invest in the growth of our business or as measures of cash that will be available to us to meet our obligations, including in relation to the Notes offered hereby. You should compensate for these limitations by relying primarily on the ASDA Group's IFRS results and using these Non-IFRS Measures only in a supplemental manner to evaluate the ASDA Group's performance. Our primary Non-IFRS Measures are defined as follows: _EBITDA_ EBITDA, when used in this Offering Memorandum, is calculated by adding back to the Company's profit for the period income tax expense, finance income, finance costs and amortisation and depreciation. By eliminating potential differences in results of operations between periods caused by factors such as depreciation and amortisation, financing and capital structures and taxation positions or regimes, we believe EBITDA can provide a useful additional basis for comparing our operating performance with industry peers. _EBITDA Margin_ EBITDA Margin means the Company's EBITDA as a percentage of total revenue for the relevant period. _Adjusted EBITDA_ Adjusted EBITDA, when used in this Offering Memorandum, means the Company's EBITDA for a particular period as adjusted for certain historical costs, including impairment charges for both tangible, intangible and leased assets, asset write-offs, elimination of IFRS 16 impact, pension guarantees, share option costs and the removal of one-time items including ATM ("Automated Teller Machines") tax rebates, one-off bonus payments, one-off contract implementation costs, estimated merger costs in relation to the proposed merger with Sainsburys, increased pension contributions as a result of changes in eligibility criteria and restructuring costs relating to significant restructuring programmes. 4 ----- _Adjusted EBITDA Margin_ Adjusted EBITDA Margin means the Company's Adjusted EBITDA as a percentage of total revenue (including petrol) for the relevant period. _Pro forma Adjusted EBITDA Pro forma Adjusted EBITDA, when used in this Offering Memorandum, means the Company's Adjusted_ EBITDA for a particular period as adjusted for the removal of Walmart royalties and IT costs and their replacement with new costs under the TSA with Walmart, other adjustments including the impact of the 2020 leap year and estimated costs relating to ASDA operating as a standalone group, one-off net impact of costs and benefits associated with COVID-19 and adjustment for certain anticipated cost savings, EG foodservice partnership synergies, synergies from the roll-out of the ASDA wholesale convenience business, the EBITDA associated with the Forecourt Assets and the Excluded Forecourts and the rent associated with the Warehouse Assets and Select Retail Assets. The Company believes that EBITDA, Adjusted EBITDA and Pro forma Adjusted EBITDA (collectively, the "EBITDA Measures") provide useful information to investors about its results of operations for the following reasons: (a) they are, or will be going forward, among the measures used by the Company's Board of Directors and management to evaluate the ASDA Group's underlying operating performance, review business trends, identify strategies to improve results and make day-to-day operating decisions, and (b) they allow a comparison of the Company's results across periods and results across companies in the industry in which the ASDA Group operates on a consistent basis, by removing the effects on the ASDA Group's operating performance of its capital structure (such as the varying levels of interest expense), asset base and capital investment cycle (such as depreciation and amortisation) and items largely outside the control of management (such as income taxes). None of the EBITDA Measures should be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of the ASDA Group's operating performance reported in accordance with IFRS. The EBITDA Measures have limitations as analytical tools, some of which are as follows: - the EBITDA Measures do not reflect the Group's cash expenditures or future requirements for capital investments or contractual commitments; - the EBITDA Measures do not reflect changes in, or cash requirements for, the Group's working capital needs; - none of the EBITDA Measures reflects the interest expense on the Group's debt or the cash requirements necessary to service interest or principal payments on the Group's debt; - although depreciation and amortisation are non-cash charges, assets are depreciated or amortised over differing estimated useful lives and the assets being depreciated and amortised will often have to be replaced in the future, and the EBITDA Measures do not reflect any cash requirements for such replacements; - the EBITDA Measures exclude certain tax payments that may represent a reduction in cash available to the Group; - the EBITDA Measures are not adjusted for all non-cash income or expense items that are reflected in the Company's income statement; - other companies in the industry in which the Group operates may calculate their own EBITDA measures differently than the Company does, limiting their usefulness as comparative measures; - our calculation and presentation of the EBITDA Measures in this Offering Memorandum is similar to, but different from, the calculation of Consolidated EBITDA under the Indentures governing the Notes offered hereby or the agreements governing our Revolving Credit Facilities. In particular, EBITDA reflects the adoption of IFRS 16 by the Company effective January 1, 2019, while Adjusted EBITDA and Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA calculations under the Indentures may not. Accordingly the EBITDA Measures do not provide precise indications as to the level of our adherence to the terms of our Indentures and the agreements governing our Revolving Credit Facilities; and - certain adjustments made in calculating Adjusted EBITDA and _Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA contain estimates that management believes reflect the underlying results of operations and are therefore subjective in nature and reflect certain adjustments for anticipated cost savings, synergies and other estimates that may not be realised, whether in part or at all. _Like-for-like sales growth (excluding petrol)_ Like-for-like sales growth (excluding petrol) is a measure of annual growth of sales (excluding VAT) 5 ----- calculated as comparable current year sales minus prior year sales for the current year comparable sales divided by prior year sales for the current year comparable sales. Current year comparable sales includes all revenue except petrol sales, sales generated from stores in the first twelve complete calendar months following grand opening, sales generated from stores that have permanently closed, sales generated from stores that have been temporarily closed for more than two consecutive complete calendar months within the previous twelve full calendar months, financial services commissions, toyou sales and George international franchise sales. _Free Cash Flow_ Free Cash Flow is calculated as Adjusted EBITDA less capital expenditure. The ASDA Group uses Free Cash Flow as a liquidity measure to monitor cash flow generation. The Company presents Free Cash Flow because, in the Company's view, it provides investors with useful information about the Company's underlying ability to generate and extract cash flows from its various subsidiaries in order to make interest and principal payments on the Group's debt, including the Notes offered hereby. Free Cash Flow is not a measure of liquidity under IFRS and has limitations as an analytical tool, some of which are as follows: - it does not represent the residual cash flow available for discretionary expenditures by the ASDA Group, particularly because, in the case of pre-tax free cash flow, the ASDA Group's various tax payment obligations are not deducted from such measure; - it does not deduct cash flows used by the ASDA Group in financing activities; - it is not a direct measurement of cash flows and attempts to derive and measure the ASDA Group's ability to service debt from income statement data of the Company. Accordingly, it does not directly correlate to the actual collection of cash. In addition, Free Cash Flow does not take into account changes in working capital of the ASDA Group that are otherwise factored in when calculating its net cash from operating activities; - it does not deduct certain other items settled in cash; and - other companies in the industries in which the ASDA Group operates may calculate Free Cash Flow differently than it does, limiting its usefulness as a comparative measure. _Cash Conversion_ Cash conversion is defined as Free Cash Flow divided by Adjusted EBITDA. _Capital expenditure_ Capital expenditure is defined as the total cost of assets classified as property, plant and equipment and intangible assets that the Company takes ownership of within a financial period (as opposed to the IFRS measurement of capital expenditure, which is based on cash flows). _Pro forma net debt Pro forma net debt consists of the Issuers' pro forma indebtedness in respect of the Notes, the Term_ Loan Facilities and leases, net of ASDA's estimated average cash and cash equivalents from January 4 to February 2, 2021 (inclusive), as adjusted to give pro forma effect to the consummation of the Transactions on the Acquisition Completion Date. Pro forma net debt does not include any indebtedness in respect of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, which is expected to be repaid from the proceeds of the Warehouse Sale Transactions, or the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility, which is expected to be repaid with the proceeds of the Forecourt Assets Disposal. See "Capitalisation." Our presentation and calculation of the ratio of _Pro forma_ net debt to _Pro forma Adjusted EBITDA is different from the calculation of Consolidated Net Leverage Ratio under the Indentures and the Senior Facilities Agreement and is not indicative of our level of adherence to the terms of the Indentures or the Senior Facilities Agreement. See "Description of the Senior Secured Notes," "Description of the Senior Notes" and "Description of Certain _Financing Arrangements."_ 6 ----- _Pro forma net senior secured debt Pro forma net senior secured debt consists of the Issuers'_ _pro forma indebtedness in respect of the_ Senior Secured Notes and the Term Loan Facilities, net of ASDA's estimated average cash and cash equivalents from January 4 to February 2, 2021 (inclusive), as adjusted to give _pro forma effect to the consummation of the Transactions on the Acquisition Completion Date. Pro forma net senior secured debt does not include any indebtedness in respect of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, which is expected to be repaid from the proceeds of the Warehouse Sale Transactions, or the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility, which is expected to be repaid with the proceeds of the Forecourt Assets Disposal. See "Capitalisation." Our presentation and calculation of the ratio of Pro forma net senior secured debt to Pro _forma Adjusted EBITDA is different from the calculation of Consolidated Senior Secured Net Leverage_ Ratio under the Indentures and the Senior Facilities Agreement and is not indicative of our level of adherence to the terms of the Indentures or the Senior Facilities Agreement. See "Description of the Senior _Secured Notes" and "Description of Certain Financing Arrangements." Pro forma interest expense Pro forma interest expense reflects the blended interest expense associated with the Notes, Term Loan_ Facilities and our leases for the 12 months ended September 30, 2020, as if the Transactions had occurred on October 1, 2019. Pro forma interest expense excludes charges related to allocated debt issuance costs, leases of Warehouse Assets or Select Retail Assets or other indebtedness. Pro forma interest expense has been presented for illustrative purposes only and does not purport to represent what our interest expense would have actually been had the above mentioned transactions occurred on the date assumed, nor does it purport to project our interest expense for any future period or our financial condition at any future date.

Section Title: NOTICE TO AUSTRIAN INVESTORS
Subsection Title: Reconciliation of Non-IFRS Measures
Subsubsection Text: We present a reconciliation of the EBITDA Measures, Free Cash Flow and Cash Conversion to the most directly comparable measure calculated and presented in accordance with IFRS and discuss their limitations. For a reconciliation of these Non-IFRS Measures and such discussions, see "Summary _Consolidated Financial and Other Financial Data—Other Financial Data."_

Section Title: NOTICE TO AUSTRIAN INVESTORS
Subsection Title: Other Financial, Operational and As Adjusted Data
Subsubsection Text: This Offering Memorandum includes certain key performance indicators and other financial, nonfinancial operational and as adjusted data. This information has been provided for informational purposes only and should not be considered indicative of actual results that would have been achieved had the as adjusted for transactions been completed on the dates indicated and do not purport to indicate our future consolidated results of operations or financial position. Our use or computation of these indicators may not be comparable with the use or computation of similarly titled measures reported by other companies. None of the key performance indicators or other non-financial operating data included in this Offering Memorandum should be considered in isolation or as an alternative to any indicator of our operating performance, cash flows or other measure of performance derived in accordance with IFRS. See "Summary Historical Consolidated Financial Information and Other Financial Data." These data have been prepared solely for the purpose of this Offering Memorandum, some of which may not be prepared in the ordinary course of our financial reporting, may not be part of our financial statements and may not have not been audited.

Section Title: NOTICE TO AUSTRIAN INVESTORS
Subsection Title: Rounding Adjustments
Subsubsection Text: Certain numerical figures set out in this Offering Memorandum, including financial data presented in millions or thousands, certain operating data, percentages describing market share and penetration rates, have been subject to rounding adjustments and, as a result, the totals of the data included in this Offering Memorandum may vary slightly from the actual arithmetic totals of such information. Percentages and amounts reflecting changes over time periods relating to financial and other data set forth in the sections entitled _"Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations"_ are calculated using the numerical data in the consolidated financial information of the Company or the tabular presentation of other data (subject to rounding) contained in this Offering Memorandum, as applicable, and not using the numerical data in the narrative description thereof. Figures shown as totals in some tables and elsewhere may not be exact arithmetic aggregations of the figures that precede them. 7 -----

Section Title: NOTICE TO AUSTRIAN INVESTORS
Subsubsection Text: This Offering Memorandum has not been and will not be approved and/or published pursuant to the Austrian Capital Markets Act (Kapitalmarktgesetz), as amended ("KMG"), and has not been passported into Austria pursuant to the EU Prospectus Regulation. Neither this Offering Memorandum nor any other document connected therewith constitutes a prospectus according to the EU Prospectus Regulation and neither this Offering Memorandum nor any other document connected therewith may be distributed, passed on or disclosed to any person in Austria other than as permitted in this paragraph. No steps may be taken that would constitute a public offering of the Notes in Austria and the offering of the Notes may not be advertised in Austria. Any offer of the Notes in Austria may only be made to any legal entity which is a "qualified investor" within the meaning of Article 2(e) of the EU Prospectus Regulation; and provided that no such offer of the Notes shall require us or the Initial Purchasers to publish a prospectus pursuant to Article 3 of the EU Prospectus Regulation. For the purposes of this provision, the expression a "public offering of Notes" means any communication (whether originating from the Issuers or a financial intermediary) to the public in any form and by any means, presenting sufficient information on the terms of the offer and the Notes to be offered (or an invitation to subscribe such Notes), so as to enable an investor to decide to purchase or subscribe to the Notes. x ----- ### NOTICE TO BELGIAN INVESTORS This Offering Memorandum relates to a private placement of the Notes and does not constitute an offer to the public in Belgium to subscribe for or acquire the Notes. The Notes may therefore not be distributed in Belgium by way of an offer of securities to the public, pursuant to the EU Prospectus Regulation or the Belgian Law of 11 July 2018 on the public offering of investment instruments and the admission of investment instruments to trading on a regulated market, as amended (the "Belgian

Section Title: FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: This Offering Memorandum includes "forward-looking statements," within the meaning of the securities laws and certain other jurisdictions, based on current expectations and projections about future events, including: - competitive pressures and the actions of competitors in our industry; - the impact of COVID-19 on our business and industry; - the United Kingdom's withdrawal from the European Union; - risks related to our reputation and brand; - adverse developments related to the safety and quality of our products and/or health concerns; - our exposure to economic and other trends; - changing consumer preferences and integrating them into our product selection; - the impact on our business of unforeseen catastrophic events, such as war, terrorist attacks, civil unrest, disruptive geopolitical events, epidemics, pandemics or natural disasters; - fluctuations in the availability and price of food ingredients and products, commodities and packaging material, as well as in the price of electricity and fuel; - inability to implement our business strategy or maintain and develop our omni-channel offer; - competitive pressures in retail industries; - the efficiency of our supply chain; - our reliance on third-party suppliers and partners to comply with obligations; - increased transportation costs or disruption to transportation services; - inability to keep pace with new technological developments; - risks in relation to our online presence; - disruptions in the IT infrastructure that we use; - open source software restrictions on our ability to exploit our proprietary software and IT systems; - effective function of technology-based systems; - impact of social media on our reputation; - loss as a result of operational risk; - increased expenses pursuant to commercial leases; - interference with our operations due to disruptions in our workforce or suppliers' workforce or labour disputes; - failure to attract and retain qualified colleagues, increases in labour costs and social charges and other changes to wage regulations; - the risk of claims by third parties on, or our failure or inability to protect, our intellectual property rights; - robbery, shop crime and fraud in our stores; - the seasonal or cyclical nature of certain of our sales and working capital requirements; - exposure to payments risks, system failures and security breaches; - risks related to acquisitions; - our dependence on the services of key executives; - increased criminal sophistication; - risks related to providing pharmacy services; - changes in results of our pharmacy business; 14 ----- - risks related to providing optometry services; - fluctuations related to brokers' opinions of pricing for certain of our real estate assets; - other risks relating to legal and regulatory issues; - other risks associated with the Group's structure, financial profile, the Notes, the Transactions and other indebtedness discussed under "Risk Factors;" and - other factors discussed or referred to in this Offering Memorandum. All statements other than statements of historical facts included in this Offering Memorandum, including, without limitation, statements regarding the Group's future financial position, risks and uncertainties related to the Group's business, strategy, capital expenditures and the Group's plans and objectives for future operations, may be deemed to be forward-looking statements. These forward- looking statements are subject to a number of risks and uncertainties, including those identified under the "Risk _Factors" section in this Offering Memorandum. Words such as "believe," "expect," "anticipate," "may,"_ "assume," "plan," "intend," "will," "should," "estimate," "risk," "target," "objectives," "outlook," "probably," "project," "seek" and similar expressions or the negatives of these expressions are intended to identify forward-looking statements. In addition, from time to time the Group or its representatives, acting in respect of information provided by us, have made or may make forward-looking statements orally or in writing and these forward-looking statements may be included in but are not limited to press releases (including on the Group's website), reports to the Group's security holders and other communications. Although the Group believes that the expectations reflected in such forward-looking statements are reasonable, the Group can give no assurance that such expectations will prove to be correct. Any forwardlooking statement speaks only as of the date on which it is made and the Group undertakes no obligation to publicly update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise. All subsequent written and oral forward-looking statements attributable to us or to persons acting on the Group's behalf are expressly qualified in their entirety by the cautionary statements referred to above and contained elsewhere in this Offering Memorandum, including those set forth under the section entitled "Risk Factors." The COVID-19 situation adds significant uncertainty to our operating environment and may have the effect of magnifying the impact of the risk factors described herein and may lead to unanticipated further risks. The risks described in the "Risk Factors" section in this Offering Memorandum are not exhaustive. Other sections of this Offering Memorandum describe additional factors that could adversely affect the Group's business, financial condition or results of operations. Moreover, the Group operates in a very competitive and rapidly changing environment. New risk factors emerge from time to time and it is not possible for us to predict all such risk factors, nor can the Group assess the impact of all such risk factors on its business or the extent to which any factor, or combination of factors, may cause actual results to differ materially from those contained in any forward-looking statements, particularly in regards to forwardlooking statements relating to or which may be impacted by the COVID-19 situation. Given these risks and uncertainties, you should not place undue reliance on forward-looking statements as a prediction of actual results.

Section Title: TAX CONSIDERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Prospective purchasers of the Notes are advised to consult their own tax advisors as to the consequences of purchasing, holding and disposing of the Notes, including, without limitation, the application of U.S. Federal, United Kingdom and Jersey tax laws to their particular situations, as well as any consequences to them under the laws of any other taxing jurisdiction, and the consequences of purchasing the Notes at prices other than the initial issue prices in the Offering. See "Certain Tax _Considerations."_ 15 -----

Section Title: HISTORICAL AND CURRENT MARKET AND INDUSTRY DATA
Subsubsection Text: It is difficult to obtain precise industry and market information in the Group's industry. Historical and current market and competitive position data, as well as statistical data, estimates and forecasts that are based on independent industry publications, surveys or studies conducted by management or by thirdparty industry consultants and market research firms such as Euromonitor International Limited ("Euromonitor"): Retailing 2020 Edition, Kantar Worldpanel ("Kantar") and the Office for National Statistics ("ONS"), or other publicly available information from sources that are generally believed to be reliable, as well as other information based on our internal sources, are used throughout this Offering Memorandum, including in the sections "Summary," "Risk Factors," "Management's Discussion and _Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations," "Industry" and "Business." With respect to_ Kantar data presented in this Offering Memorandum, references to the "United Kingdom" do not include Northern Ireland. Industry surveys and publications generally state that the information contained therein has been obtained from sources believed to be reliable, but the accuracy and completeness of information contained therein is not guaranteed. While the Group accepts responsibility for the accurate extraction and reproduction of this market data, the Group has not independently verified such data and cannot guarantee its accuracy or completeness. Some of the information herein has also been extrapolated from market data, reports, surveys and studies using our experience and internal estimates. Elsewhere in this Offering Memorandum, statements regarding the industry in which we operate and our position in this industry are based solely on our experience, internal studies, estimates and surveys, and our own investigation of market conditions. We believe that the sources of such information in this Offering Memorandum are reliable, but there can be no assurance that any of these assumptions is accurate or correctly reflects our position in our industry, and none of our internal surveys or information has been verified by any independent sources. Further, the data and statistical information in this Offering Memorandum may differ from information provided by our competitors or from information found in current or future studies conducted by market research institutes, consultancy firms or independent sources. While the Group is not aware of any misstatements regarding any industry or similar data presented herein, such data involve risks and uncertainties and are subject to change based on various factors, including those discussed under the "Risk Factors" section in this Offering Memorandum. As a result, neither we nor any of the Initial Purchasers make any representation as to the accuracy or completeness of any such information in this Offering Memorandum. All the information set forth in this Offering Memorandum relating to the industry and markets in which the Company operates has been obtained from independent research, unless otherwise indicated. Neither the Issuers nor any of the Initial Purchasers have independently verified this information and cannot guarantee its accuracy. The COVID-19 pandemic has adversely affected the industry and markets in which we operate. Both the extent of such adverse impact and the time it may take for the COVID-19 pandemic to end and for our industry and markets to recover from it remain uncertain. Accordingly, the industry publications, reports, surveys or studies from third-party data providers to which this Offering Memorandum refers, even if and where updated to reflect the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, including relating to market evolution and market share estimates may not, in light of the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, accurately reflect the current or expected market conditions, trends and growth rates. As the COVID-19 impact is ongoing, even such industry publications, reports, surveys or studies from third-party data providers to which this Offering Memorandum refers and which purport to reflect the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, as applicable, are inherently incomplete as to the full effect of the COVID-19 pandemic. See "Industry" and "Risk Factors— _Risks Relating to Our Business and Industry—Risks Relating to Our General Operations—The impact of COVID-19 on our business and industry is significant and its effects will continue to create uncertainty in our market and materially impact our business, financial condition and results of operations for the foreseeable future due to many factors, most of which are beyond our control."_

Section Title: TRADE MARKS AND TRADE NAMES
Subsection Title: BROKERS' OPINIONS OF PRICING The Brokers' Opinions of Pricing
Subsubsection Text: The Issuers received a broker's opinion of pricing dated November 26, 2020 and prepared as of October 20, 2020 issued by external real estate adviser Newsteer Real Estate Advisers ("Newsteer") related to the ASDA Group's portfolio of 485 properties comprising 483 trading stores and two offices held on a freehold and long leasehold basis (the "ASDA Store and Office Portfolio") (inclusive of the Select Retail Assets and the Substitute Retail Assets) and a broker's opinion of pricing dated November 17, 2020 and prepared as of October 20, 2020 issued by external real estate adviser Colliers International ("Colliers") related to the ASDA Group's portfolio of 31 distribution sites held on a freehold and long leasehold basis (the "ASDA

Section Title: TRADE MARKS AND TRADE NAMES
Subsection Title: Distribution Sites Portfolio" and, together with the ASDA Store and Office Portfolio, the "ASDA Property Portfolio") (the broker's opinion of pricing from Newsteer and the broker's opinion of pricing from Colliers
Subsubsection Text: are referred to collectively in this Offering Memorandum as the "Brokers' Opinions of Pricing"). The ASDA Property Portfolio does not, and thus the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing do not, include certain other properties, including retail rack-rented leasehold properties (131 properties), office leasehold properties (one property), standalone petrol forecourts (18 properties), non-operational properties (ten freehold properties and seven leasehold properties) and non-UK properties (five properties). The Brokers' Opinions of Pricing also do not include opinions of pricing relating to petrol forecourts on a standalone basis (save that where trading stores benefit from petrol forecourts, Newsteer has reflected the existence of petrol forecourts with an addition of 5% to the base shell rental pricing for the relevant trading stores). Additionally, the ASDA Property Portfolio does not, and thus the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing do not, reflect any income received from tenants, concessions or third-party interests. The Brokers' Opinions of Pricing are intended to be guides to the likely pricing of the ASDA Property Portfolio prior to negotiation and/or agency instructions as may occur during a routine sales process. The Brokers' Opinions of Pricing were not prepared in accordance with the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors' Valuation–Global Standards (the "RICS Red Book Global Standards").

Section Title: TRADE MARKS AND TRADE NAMES
Subsection Title: Key Findings
Subsubsection Text: Subject to the facts, assumptions and qualifications set out in the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing and summarised below, the ASDA Store and Office Portfolio had an aggregate capital pricing of £9,354,700,000 as of October 20, 2020 (based on 485 sites). The ASDA Distribution Sites Portfolio had an aggregate capital pricing of £925,700,000 (based on 31 sites) as of October 20, 2020. The Select Retail Assets had an aggregate capital pricing of £483,794,000 (based on 23 sites) and the Substitute Retail Assets had an aggregate capital pricing of £639,501,000 (based on 15 sites), in each case as of October 20, 2020. The capital pricing of the properties located in each of the jurisdictions where real estate will be pledged as collateral (including the Select Retail Assets and the Substitute Retail Assets (but, in the case of the latter, only if consents, approvals or certifications are outstanding at the relevant time in relation to the grant of leases and security interests in respect of any Warehouse Asset or the transfer of any Warehouse Asset to Bellis Select Warehouse Limited, or the registration of any of the foregoing, in each case as required pursuant to the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility)) for the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility is broken down as follows: (i) based on the Colliers broker's opinion of pricing of the ASDA Distribution Sites Portfolio (which, for the purposes of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, comprises 30 distribution properties): £820,000,000 in England, £62,200,000 in Scotland and £24,300,000 in Wales (total aggregate capital pricing: £906,500,000); (ii) based on the Newsteer broker's opinion of pricing of the Select Retail Assets: £420,958,000 in England and £62,836,000 in Scotland (total aggregate capital pricing: £483,794,000) and (iii) based on the Newsteer broker's opinion of pricing of the Substitute Retail Assets (which includes the addition of 5% to the base shell rental pricing to reflect the existence of petrol forecourts): £629,301,000 in England and £10,200,000 in Wales (total aggregate capital pricing: £639,501,000). See "Risk Factors—Risks Relating to Our Business and Industry—Risks Relating to Our _General Operations—We rent certain of our properties pursuant to commercial leases that may be subject to adjustments that could increase expenses and have a materially adverse impact on our business, results of operations and financial condition," "Risk Factors—Risks Relating to Financial, Reporting and Other Matters—We cannot assure you that the projections or assumptions used, estimates made or procedures followed in the third-party brokers' opinions of pricing of our portfolio of real estate assets are correct, accurate or complete."_ 17 -----

Section Title: TRADE MARKS AND TRADE NAMES
Subsection Title: Reliance
Subsubsection Text: The information presented in the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing is presented for illustrative purposes only. The Brokers' Opinions of Pricing are strictly confidential and provided only for the purposes of the Transaction and providing an indication of pricing for the benefit of the Issuers in connection with the preparation of this Offering Memorandum (the "Original Purposes"). Newsteer and Colliers have accepted no responsibility whatsoever to any third party for any part of the contents of the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing and as such no third party may rely upon the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing. Prospective investors should be aware that the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing were prepared as of October 20, 2020 and are not as of the date of this Offering Memorandum. Neither Newsteer nor Colliers has been requested to update or revise any of the information contained in the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing as of any later date or the date of this Offering Memorandum, nor will they be asked to do so prior to the issuance of the Notes or at any later date. Accordingly, the information included in the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing may not reflect the current physical, economic, competitive, market or other conditions with respect to the Group Property Portfolio. Commercial property is generally bought and sold by reference to its security of income generation, development potential, future rent generation or potential for capital growth. Any events that have a material impact on a property's ability to trade or the development of the immediate vicinity can consequently have a significant effect on pricing, more so than other property types. Examples of such events are: - macroeconomic conditions in the United Kingdom, the European Union and elsewhere; - an economic downturn, including as a result of COVID-19; - potential changes to the competitive landscape for grocery retail; - capital expenditure requirements; - changes in occupier and investor demand; - supply and demand generally affecting pricing; - adaptability or obsolescence; - regulation (e.g. minimum energy efficiency standards); - changes in consumer behaviour and shopping habits, either from gradual changes over time or as a result of any other event listed above or under "Risk Factors" in this Offering Memorandum; and - other factors discussed or referred to in this Offering Memorandum. The foregoing factors and others described under "Risk Factors" should not be construed as exhaustive. Due to such uncertainties and risks, readers are cautioned not to place reliance on the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing. Pricings change over time and an opinion of pricing given on a particular date may not be valid on an earlier or later date, when both market conditions and sale circumstances may be different as a result of which we may not be able to realise such pricing upon a disposal. As neither Newsteer, Colliers nor any other external real estate adviser has been requested to update or revise the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing or prepare new opinions of pricing of the ASDA Property Portfolio for any date after October 20, 2020, if an opinion of pricing of the ASDA Property Portfolio was conducted today there can be no assurance that it would not be materially different from the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing. As a result, the information contained in the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing may no longer reflect the characteristics of the property portfolio as of the date of this Offering Memorandum or any date thereafter. Prospective investors should be aware that the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing have been issued on the basis that they can only be relied upon by the Issuers for the Original Purposes.

Section Title: TRADE MARKS AND TRADE NAMES
Subsection Title: Basis of Brokers' Opinions of Pricing
Subsubsection Text: The Brokers' Opinions of Pricing of the relevant properties have been prepared on the basis of existing use of such properties, as supermarkets, offices or distribution warehouses. The opinions of pricing do not reflect any alternative use, intensification or development of use of these properties. In order to conduct its opinion of pricing, both Newsteer and Colliers relied on floor areas of the relevant properties as provided by ASDA and Newsteer and Colliers have assumed that these floor areas have been defined in compliance with the RICS Measurement Standards. For the purposes of its opinion of 18 ----- pricing, Colliers also relies on floor areas for certain of the properties that were measured by its rating department under a separate instruction from ASDA, which comply with the current edition of RICS Measurement Standards. Both Brokers' Opinions' of Pricing have been produced on a desktop basis only without visual inspection of the properties and without undertaking the typical due diligence that would normally be entered into by a purchaser. See "—Terms and Assumptions" and "—Methodology" for further assumptions providing the basis of the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing.

Section Title: TRADE MARKS AND TRADE NAMES
Subsection Title: Terms and Assumptions
Subsubsection Text: The opinions of pricing of all properties were based on their existing use of the properties. Newsteer and Colliers made various assumptions as to tenure, letting, taxation, town planning, and the condition and repair of buildings and sites—including, among other things, ground conditions and contamination. If any of the information or assumptions on which the studies are based are subsequently found to be incorrect, the opinions of pricing may also be incorrect and should be reconsidered. In particular, in preparation of their respective broker's opinion of pricing, Newsteer and Colliers assumed each property to be the authorised use under planning legislation and in accordance with the use registered with the relevant regulatory agency. During the course of their engagement, Newsteer and Colliers did not perform site inspections, environmental audit, tests of services and amenities, investigations or tests as to the condition of the properties. Newsteer and Colliers did not make planning or permitting enquiries and did not examine deeds, leases or other documents in respect of tenure or title to the ASDA Group's properties, building structure and condition, planning, environmental or other statutory information. The Brokers' Opinions of Pricing assumed, among others, that as at October 20, 2020 (i) in the case of Newsteer, the properties are let to ASL and in the case of Colliers, the properties are let to ASDA or to a AAA-tenant, which could include ASDA, and in both cases that ASDA are in the market for all the properties and benefits from an excellent rating, such as AAA and a very low risk of failure, (ii) all properties are freehold or long leasehold and all title, tenure, lettings, planning, taxation, statutory and local authority requirements are complied with and all properties possess a good and marketable title free from any onerous restrictions or conditions, (iii) all properties benefit from full access and egress rights together with sufficient parking and loading facilities and are connected to all main services, (iv) all properties are free from defect, in good repair and condition and well maintained and in marketable condition, compliant with all building, accessibility and fire safety regulations and there are no abnormalities as to repair and condition of the properties, (v) the properties have no environmental issues such as contamination, deleterious materials, flooding, ground conditions, invasive or protected plants or species and the properties are not adversely affected by any existing or proposed environmental law, (vi) the floor areas provided to Newsteer and Colliers by ASDA comply with the RICS Standards for measurement (other than those properties which were measured by Colliers as part of separate instruction and which comply with the edition of the RICS Measurement Standards current as at the date of this Offering Memorandum and upon which Colliers have relied for the purposes of their opinion on pricing) and (vii) no capital expenditure is required in respect of the properties. Both Colliers and Newsteer have assumed that each property is a vacant shell unit which benefits from fully capped off services and no tenant fit-outs or fixtures and fittings beyond a typical specification with which a vacant shell unit would be let or sold have been taken into account in the respective broker's opinion of pricing.

Section Title: TRADE MARKS AND TRADE NAMES
Subsection Title: Methodology
Subsubsection Text: The Brokers' Opinions of Pricing have been prepared on the basis of "capital pricing" and have been arrived at using comparable transactional evidence of leasing and sales transactions, adjusted to reflect the characteristics of the properties in the ASDA Property Portfolio. Capital pricing as determined by Newsteer and Colliers is based on certain qualifications and assumptions (including as to market participants (e.g., that there is a willing lessor and willing lessee, as well as a willing vendor and purchaser, in terms of demand for the properties in the open market, liens or other encumbrances, and the condition and repair of buildings and sites, including environmental matters), estimates and projections. In both cases, Newsteer and Colliers have assumed that the properties are fully leased at market rates as of October 20, 2020. Newsteer has also assumed that the properties are open for business and trading as of October 20, 2020 and are trading at sufficient levels that warrant the opinion of pricing. Colliers has determined capital pricing by assuming an "all-risks" yield to the annual rent assumed under a rental price exercise. The rental price exercise applies an overall rental price per square foot based on the gross internal floor area of each building. The yield assumes that any occupier would have an institutional-grade covenant similar to the leading grocery operators or other national or international logistics firms, which could include ASDA. The rent and yield approach is cross-checked with a capital price per square foot analysis that uses comparable transactional evidence. Benchmarks were drawn from recent 19 ----- transactions of similar properties in similar locations in the marketplace and a certain rent and yield range was then applied depending on the characteristics of the properties and their locations. The yield range applied varies from approximately 4.5% to 9.5% depending on the characteristics of the properties and their locations. For each property, it is assumed that the property is subject to an occupational lease as of October 20, 2020 on the following terms: (a) 20-year term to a AAA-rated tenant, (b) yearly indexation of the rent based on Retail Price Index with 1% / 3% collar and cap, (c) no open market rent review, (d) full repairing and insuring lease terms, (e) on institutional terms which are acceptable to landlords and tenants typical of the properties, and (f) the lease has the benefit of security of tenure pursuant to the Landlord and Tenant Act 1954. Colliers has not deducted any void costs nor any non-recoverable costs but assumes a deduction of standard purchaser's costs applicable to property assets in determining capital pricing of the ASDA Distribution Sites Portfolio. Newsteer has determined capital pricing in the case of freehold properties by applying an estimated net initial yield in perpetuity to the annual rent assumed under a rental price exercise for the freehold properties. For long leasehold properties, Newsteer has applied an estimated term yield for the remaining term to the profit rent assumed under a rental price exercise having disregarded any rent review provisions for the long leasehold properties. In each case, the yield assumes that the occupier would have an institutional-grade covenant similar to the leading grocery operators. Benchmarks were drawn from recent transactions of similar properties in similar locations in the marketplace. The rental price exercise applies an overall rental price per square foot based on the gross internal floor area of each store and the net internal floor area of each office. For each store property that benefits from a petrol filling station, Newsteer has reflected the existence of a petrol filling station with an addition of 5% to the base shell rental pricing for the stores. For each property, it is assumed that the property is subject to an occupational lease on the following terms: (a) 20-year term to an institutional-grade tenant, (b) five yearly upwards only open market rent reviews on a shell basis with appropriate rent-free incentives, (c) on institutional terms which are acceptable to landlords and tenants typical of the properties and (d) assuming that ASL is in occupation and that ASDA would have bid competitively for the properties at the time of letting and paid the market rent assessment. Newsteer has not deducted any voids nor any non-recoverable costs and has not deducted standard purchaser's costs, thereby reporting on a gross capital pricing basis. We cannot assure you that the projections or assumptions used, estimates made or procedures followed in the capital pricing of the ASDA Group's properties are correct, accurate or complete. For example, if the properties were assumed to be held with vacant possession, rather than being assumed to be occupied, the capital pricing would be materially lower. Any opinions or conclusions reached in the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing depend upon these assumptions, estimates and projections, some or all of which may or may not occur or prove to be relevant. In addition, the methodologies and assumptions used in the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing may differ from those underlying our projections and estimates contained elsewhere in this Offering Memorandum. The foregoing are brokers' opinions of pricing as set forth in the Brokers' Opinions of Pricing and are distinct from the book value recorded on the ASDA's statement of financial position in respect of the Group's properties in the "Property, plant and equipment" and "Investment properties" line items on the statement of financial position of the Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial Statements. The Brokers' Opinions of Pricing have not been prepared in accordance with IAS 16 "Property, Plant and Equipment" or IAS 40 "Investment Property," which are the accounting principles applicable to the ASDA Group's property and investment properties. See "Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results _of Operations—Key Factors Affecting Our Results of Operations—Significant Real Estate Asset Portfolio."_ 20 -----

Section Title: TRADE MARKS AND TRADE NAMES
Subsubsection Text: We have proprietary and/or licence rights to certain trade marks or trade names that we use in conjunction with the operation of our businesses. We do not intend our use or display of other companies' trade marks or trade names to imply a relationship with, or endorsement or sponsorship of us by, any other companies. Section Title: CURRENCY PRESENTATION AND EXCHANGE RATES
Subsubsection Text: The following tables set forth, for the periods indicated below, the high, low, average and period end Bloomberg Composite Rate London expressed as pounds sterling per U.S.$1.00 and pounds sterling per €1.00. The Bloomberg Composite Rate London is a "best market" calculation, in which, at any point in time, the bid rate is equal to the highest bid rate of all contributing bank indications and the ask rate is set to the lowest ask rate offered by these banks. The Bloomberg Composite Rate London is a mid-value rate between the applied highest bid rate and the lowest ask rate. The below rates may differ from the actual rates used in the preparation of the consolidated financial information and other financial information appearing in this Offering Memorandum.
