The payments which are permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement without the consent of the Majority Senior Secured Creditors are summarised under the caption "Description of Certain Financing Arrangements—Intercreditor Agreement—Payments and Prepayments; _Subordination of the Senior Notes" (each such payment a "Permitted Payment")._ ### 134 ----- If the Group defaults on its payments under or in respect of: - the Senior Facilities, the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility or other Senior Secured Debt permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement in respect of an amount constituting principal, interest or fees, or otherwise exceeding €1,000,000 (equivalent); - the Senior Secured Notes Indenture (in respect of an amount constituting principal, interest or fees, or otherwise exceeding €2,500,000 (equivalent); and/or - the cash management facility documents in respect of an amount constituting principal, interest or fees, or otherwise exceeding €1,000,000 (equivalent), (each a "Senior Secured Debt Payment Default") the Group's ability to make Permitted Payments will be automatically suspended. In addition, if an event of default (other than a Senior Secured Debt Payment Default) has occurred under the finance documents in respect of the Senior Secured Liabilities, creditors in respect of the Senior Secured Liabilities may deliver a notice to us, the Security Agent and the Senior Notes Trustee suspending the Group's ability to make Permitted Payments for a period of up to 179 days (such notice a "Topco

Section Title: RISK FACTORS
Subsection Title: Secured Liabilities"). The Intercreditor Agreement provides that the Security Agent serves as a common
Subsubsection Text: security agent for the secured parties under the agreements under which Senior Secured Liabilities are or may be incurred and will (subject to certain limited exceptions) act with respect to such Collateral only at the direction of the relevant Instructing Group until amounts outstanding in respect of the Senior Secured Liabilities are paid in full and discharged. The creditors and counterparties under Senior Secured Liabilities, respectively, will have (unless the relevant Instructing Group otherwise consents) the exclusive right to make all decisions with respect to the enforcement of remedies relating to such Collateral. See "Description of Certain Financing Arrangements—Intercreditor _Agreement." As a result, the holders of the Senior Notes will not be able to independently pursue the remedies of a secured creditor under the Security Documents or force a sale of the asset comprising the Shared Security without the consent of or unless instructed to do so by the relevant Instructing Group, until the earlier of the expiration of the applicable standstill period and the repayment and discharge in full of the Senior Secured Liabilities. In addition, in the circumstances in which the holders of the Senior Notes would be entitled to issue enforcement instructions to the Security Agent with respect to the Shared Security, creditors in respect of indebtedness whose security interest in the Collateral ranks senior to the Senior Notes may have the right to issue enforcement instructions in relation to any Collateral that does not also secure the Senior Notes or in respect of the Collateral that is not (directly or indirectly) affected by the enforcement instructions. If the Security Agent has notified the Senior Notes Trustee that it is enforcing Collateral, no other Senior Notes creditor may take any otherwise permitted enforcement action against the relevant members of the Group while the Security Agent is taking steps to enforce the Collateral in accordance with the instructions of the instructing group where such action might be reasonably likely to adversely affect such enforcement or the amount of proceeds to be derived therefrom. The creditors and counterparties in respect of the Senior Secured Liabilities may have interests that are different from the interests of holders of the Senior Notes, and they may elect to pursue their remedies under the Security Documents at a time when it would be disadvantageous for the holders of the Senior Notes to do so. This may affect the ability of holders of the Senior Notes to recover under the Shared ### 133 ----- Security the proceeds from such Collateral, after having satisfied obligations under the Senior Secured Liabilities, are less than the aggregate amount outstanding under the Senior Notes. In addition, if the creditors in respect of the Senior Secured Liabilities direct the sale of the shares of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or the shares of another Group company through an enforcement of their first-priority Security Interests or at a time when the Security Interests have become enforceable in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, the Senior Notes Guarantees and the liens over any other assets securing the Senior Notes and each Senior Notes Guarantee may (subject to certain conditions) be released. See "Description of Certain _Financing Arrangements—Intercreditor Agreement" and "Description of the Senior Notes— Security—Release of Liens." We may also issue further indebtedness which will be entitled to rank pari passu with or senior to the Senior Notes in right and priority of payment and which will be entitled to share in the Senior Notes Collateral with the Senior Notes on a pari passu or senior-priority basis. In the event that any such debt is issued, your creditor voting rights will be diluted proportionately to the amount of debt incurred.

Section Title: RISK FACTORS
Subsection Title: Payment Stop Notice").
Subsubsection Title: The granting of the security interests in connection with the issuance of the Senior Notes, the transfer of the Forecourt Assets or the incurrence of permitted debt in the future, may create or restart hardening periods, i.e., the periods of time following the granting of security interests during which such security interests in accordance with the laws applicable in certain jurisdictions.
Subsubsection Text: The granting of security interests to secure the Senior Notes and the Senior Notes Guarantees following the Issue Date may create hardening periods for such security interests in certain jurisdictions. The granting of shared security interests to secure future indebtedness permitted to be secured on the Senior Notes Collateral may restart or reopen such hardening periods in particular, as the Senior Notes Indenture permits the release and retaking of security granted in favour of the Senior Notes in certain circumstances, including in connection with the incurrence of future indebtedness and a Permitted Reorganisation. Please see "Description of the Senior Notes—Security." A number of the forecourts owned by ASDA and its subsidiaries are adjacent to, and captured under the same title as, its retail assets. In order to execute the Forecourt Disposal and any required Excluded Forecourt Divestments, we will separate the title to such forecourts from the title to the adjacent retail assets. The applicable hardening period for these new security interests can run from the moment each new security interest has been granted or perfected. At each time, if the security interest granted or recreated were to be enforced before the end of the respective hardening period applicable in such jurisdiction, it may be declared void or ineffective and/or it may not be possible to enforce it. Please see "Certain _Insolvency Considerations and_ _Limitations on Validity and Enforceability of the Notes Guarantees and Security Interests."_

Section Title: RISK FACTORS
Subsection Title: Payment Stop Notice").
Subsubsection Title: Claims of the Group's senior secured creditors and, if the Revolving Credit Facilities are designated as super senior liabilities in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, claims in respect of any such Super Senior Liabilities will have priority with respect to their security over the claims of Senior Notes holders, to the extent of the value of the assets securing such indebtedness.
Subsubsection Text: Claims of the Group's senior secured creditors and, in the event the Revolving Credit Facilities are designated as super senior liabilities in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, claims in respect of any such Super Senior Liabilities will have priority with respect to the assets securing their indebtedness over the claims of holders of the Senior Notes. As such, each Senior Notes Guarantee will be effectively subordinated to any secured indebtedness ranking senior to the Senior Notes (including ### 135 ----- obligations with respect to the Senior Secured Liabilities) to the extent of the value of the assets securing such indebtedness or other obligations if such assets secure the Senior Notes on a junior-priority basis or do not secure the Senior Notes. In the event of any foreclosure, dissolution, winding-up, liquidation, reorganisation, administration or other bankruptcy or insolvency proceeding of any Guarantor that has secured obligations, holders of senior secured indebtedness and creditors in respect of Super Senior Liabilities, if any, will have prior claims to the assets of the relevant Guarantor that constitute their collateral. Subject to the limitations referred to under the caption "—Risks Relating to _the Group's Structure—Each _Notes Guarantee and security interest will be subject to certain limitations on enforcement and may be limited by applicable law or subject to certain defences that may limit its validity and enforceability," the_ holders of the Senior Notes will participate ratably with all holders of the unsecured indebtedness of the relevant Guarantor (other than indebtedness to which the Senior Notes Guarantees have been expressly subordinated) to the extent the Senior Notes are not repaid in full from the proceeds of an enforcement of the Senior Notes Collateral, and, potentially with all of their other general creditors, based upon the respective amounts owed to each holder or creditor, in the remaining assets of the relevant Guarantor. In the event that any of the senior secured indebtedness or Super Senior Liabilities (if any) of the relevant Guarantor becomes due or the creditors in respect thereof commence enforcement proceedings against Collateral that secures such indebtedness, the Senior Notes Collateral remaining after repayment of that secured indebtedness may not be sufficient to repay all amounts owing in respect of the relevant Senior Notes Guarantee. As a result, holders of Senior Notes may receive less, ratably, than holders of senior secured indebtedness and creditors in respect of Super Senior Liabilities (if any) of the relevant Guarantor. As of September 30, 2020, on a pro forma basis to reflect the Acquisition and the Financing, we would have had an aggregate principal amount of £3,935.0 million (equivalent) of secured indebtedness outstanding secured by liens on assets that do not secure the Senior Notes and liens which rank in priority to the liens securing the Senior Notes. The Group may also issue further indebtedness which will be entitled to rank pari passu with or senior to the Senior Notes in right and priority of payment and which will be entitled to share in the Collateral with the Senior Notes on a pari passu or senior basis, including £690.0 million available for borrowing under the Revolving Credit Facilities. In the event that any such debt is further issued, your creditor voting rights will be diluted proportionately to the amount of indebtedness incurred.

Section Title: RISK FACTORS
Subsection Title: Payment Stop Notice").
Subsubsection Title: The ability of holders of Senior Notes to recover under the pledge of the shares of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and other Shared Security may be limited.
Subsubsection Text: The obligations under the Senior Notes and the Senior Notes Guarantees will be secured by security interests over the Shared Security on a second-priority basis. First-priority security interests over the Shared Security will be granted for the benefit of creditors in respect of Senior Secured Liabilities. Holders of the Senior Notes may not be able to recover on the Shared Security as the creditors in respect of the Senior Secured Liabilities will have a prior claim on all proceeds realised from any enforcement of such Shared Security and any distressed disposal with respect to such Shared Security, and the Senior Notes will need to share any remaining proceeds from such enforcement with any other secured creditor ranking _pari passu with the Senior Notes, pro rata. If the proceeds realised from the enforcement of such Shared_ Security exceed the Senior Secured Liabilities, any excess amount of such proceeds will be paid to the Senior Notes Trustee on behalf of itself and the holders of the Senior Notes. If there are no excess proceeds, or if the amount of such excess proceeds is less than the aggregate amount of the obligations under the Senior Notes, the holders of Senior Notes will not fully recover (if at all) under such Shared Security. In addition, the Shared Security may not be liquid, and its value to other parties may be less than its value to us. Likewise, the Group cannot assure you that there will be a market for the pledged shares or other Shared Security or that, if such market does exist, there will not be substantial delays in their liquidation. The shares of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer may also have limited value in the event of a bankruptcy, insolvency or other similar proceeding in relation to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer because all of the obligations of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer (subject to the release mechanism in the Intercreditor Agreement) (including the Senior Notes Guarantees) must be satisfied prior to distribution to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer's equity holders. As a result, the holders of the Senior Notes may not recover anything of value in the case of an enforcement sale of shares pledged in the Senior Secured Notes Issuer. In addition, the value of the Issuer Share Collateral may fluctuate over time. Pursuant to the Intercreditor Agreement, the Senior Notes Trustee and holders of the Senior Notes will (subject to certain limited exceptions) not be able to force a sale of the Shared Security or otherwise independently pursue the remedies of a secured creditor under the Security Documents relating to such Collateral for so long as any Senior Secured Liabilities remain outstanding and, if the creditors in respect of the Senior Secured Liabilities enforce their security, they will have priority over the holders of the Senior ### 136 ----- Notes with respect to the proceeds from this Collateral. See "—The rights to enforce remedies with respect _to the Senior Notes Collateral securing the Senior Notes and with respect to the Senior Notes Guarantees are limited as long as any super senior or senior secured debt is outstanding." As such, holders of the_ Senior Notes may not be able to recover on the Senior Notes Collateral if the claims of the creditors in respect of the Senior Secured Liabilities are greater than the proceeds realised from any enforcement of the Collateral. In addition, if the Security Agent directs the sale of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer's shares through an enforcement of their first-priority security interest in accordance with the Intercreditor Agreement, the second-priority security interest over such shares securing the Senior Notes and the Senior Notes Guarantees may (subject to certain conditions) be automatically released. See "Description _of Certain Financing Arrangements—Intercreditor Agreement"_ and _"Description of the Senior Notes— Security—Release of Liens."_ ### 137 -----

Section Title: RISK FACTORS
Subsection Title: Payment Stop Notice").
Subsubsection Text: If a Senior Secured Debt Payment Default occurs and for so long as a Topco Payment Stop Notice is outstanding the Group's ability to make payments in respect of the Senior Notes will be limited to payments by the Senior Notes Issuer and any other payments to which the Majority Senior Secured Creditors give their prior consent. In such circumstances the Group cannot assure you that the Group will be able to obtain such consent or, in the absence of such consent be able to meet its payment obligations in respect of the Senior Notes. For more detail please see the caption _"Description of Certain Financing _Arrangements—Intercreditor Agreement—Payments and Prepayments; Subordination of the Senior Notes."_

Section Title: RISK FACTORS
Subsubsection Text: _An investment in the Notes involves a high degree of risk. In addition to the other information contained in this Offering Memorandum, you should carefully consider the following risk factors before purchasing the Notes. The risks and uncertainties described below are not the only ones the Group faces. Additional risks and uncertainties of which the Group is not aware or that it currently believes are immaterial may also adversely affect the Group's business, financial condition, results of operations and prospects. If any of the possible events described below were to occur, the Group's business, financial condition, results of operations and prospects could be materially and adversely affected. If that happens, the Issuers may not be able to pay interest or principal on the Notes, respectively, when due, and you could lose all or part of your investment. This Offering Memorandum also contains forward-looking statements that involve risks and uncertainties. The Group's actual results may differ materially from those anticipated in these forward- looking statements as a result of various factors, including the risks described below and elsewhere in this Offering Memorandum. See "Forward-Looking Statements."_

Section Title: THE TRANSACTIONS
Subsection Title: The Acquisition and Acquisition Agreement
Subsubsection Text: On October 2, 2020, the Issa Brothers and TDR Capital (the "Shareholders") caused their jointly controlled entity, Bellis Acquisition Company 3 Limited (the "Purchaser"), to enter into the Acquisition Agreement with the Seller, a subsidiary of Walmart, pursuant to which the Purchaser committed to acquire all of the issued ordinary shares of the Company on the Acquisition Completion Date (the "Acquisition"). The Purchaser, a limited company formed under the laws of Jersey, is an indirect, wholly-owned subsidiary of the Issuers. It was formed by the Shareholders solely for the purpose of engaging in the transactions contemplated by the Acquisition Agreement and has not commenced any operations, other than as set forth in the Acquisition Agreement. Pursuant to the Acquisition Agreement, the consideration payable by the Purchaser on the Acquisition Completion Date will be £6,614.0 million (assuming an Acquisition Completion Date of February 16, 2021) (the "Purchase Consideration"). Under the terms of the Acquisition Agreement, the Seller was required to use commercially reasonable endeavours to cause the Company to make distributions to the Seller or other Walmart Group Companies of at least £1,769.5 million prior to the Acquisition Completion Date. On December 21, 2020, the Company approved a distribution of £1,769.5 million to ASDA Holdings UK Limited, of which £1,269.5 million was a distribution in specie through the transfer of intercompany receivables and £500.0 million was settled in cash. On the Acquisition Completion Date, the Company will settle outstanding intercompany payables due by the ASDA Group to Walmart Group Companies in cash. The Acquisition Agreement includes customary warranties by the Seller and the Purchaser. The Seller and the Purchaser have also separately agreed on a dedicated indemnification regime applicable to any losses arising from the Equal Value Claims. As contemplated by the Acquisition Agreement, the Acquisition will be completed following receipt of the FCA's approval, but during the pendency of the review of the Acquisition by the CMA, which is the competition authority that has the authority to review the Acquisition following referral by the European Commission. The CMA's review is ongoing. Currently, the CMA is conducting its phase 1 inquiry into the Acquisition. If the CMA identifies competition-related concerns over the course of this phase 1 inquiry, we intend to propose remedies to address these concerns, which may include the sale of certain PFS sites to unaffiliated third parties. See "—The Post_Completion Transactions—Forecourt Disposals." However, there can be no assurance that any remedies we may propose will be acceptable to the CMA. If the remedies we may propose are rejected, the CMA Clearance Date could be significantly delayed and more extensive remedies may be required from us, which could potentially include a mandated sale of the ASDA Group. See "Risk Factors—Risks Relating _to the Transactions—The Acquisition is subject to certain uncertainties and risks, which could adversely impact recoveries under the Notes."_ In connection with the CMA's review of the Acquisition, we expect the CMA to issue an IEO shortly before or immediately after Completion, which we expect to remain in force until the CMA Clearance Date. Under this IEO, the Bellis Group will not be permitted to exercise de facto control over the ASDA Group or otherwise direct its operations until the CMA Clearance Date. As a result, although we acquired the ASDA Group on the Acquisition Completion Date, we will not effectively control the ASDA Group until the CMA Clearance Date. Furthermore, while the IEO is in effect, it will prevent us from making any significant structural or organisational changes to the ASDA Group, including the Forecourt Business Disposal, the Excluded Forecourt Divestments or any other Post-Completion Transactions, unless we seek and obtain a derogation from the CMA. Accordingly, we do not intend to initiate these post-completion transactions until the CMA Clearance Date.

Section Title: THE TRANSACTIONS
Subsection Title: The Financing
Subsubsection Title: The Financing in the event that the Acquisition Completion Date occurs prior to the Issue Date
Subsubsection Text: We expect to settle the Offering after the consummation of the Acquisition. In this case, we expect to fund our payment of the Purchase Consideration on the Acquisition Completion Date using the Equity Contribution (including Walmart's Rollover Equity Investment) and amounts drawn under the Senior Facilities, the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility, the Senior Bridge Facility and the Senior Secured Bridge Facilities (the "Initial Financing") and the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. On the Issue Date, we will then use the proceeds from the Offering to repay a portion of the Initial Financing, including all ### 138 ----- amounts drawn under the Senior Bridge Facility and the Senior Secured Bridge Facilities (together with the Initial Financing and the other related transactions described in this section of the Offering Memorandum, the "Financing"). See "Use of Proceeds."

Section Title: THE TRANSACTIONS
Subsection Title: The Financing
Subsubsection Text: On the Acquisition Completion Date, the Senior Notes Issuer expects to draw the full amount of the Senior Bridge Facility under the Senior Bridge Facility Agreement and to on-lend the amounts received to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer under the Senior Financing Proceeds Loan. See "Description of Certain _Financing Arrangements."_

Section Title: THE TRANSACTIONS
Subsection Title: The Financing
Subsubsection Title: Utilisations of Senior Facilities, the Senior Secured Bridge Facilities and the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility
Subsubsection Text: On the Acquisition Completion Date, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer expects to draw the full amount of the Term Loan Facilities under the Senior Facilities Agreement, the Senior Secured Bridge Facilities and the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility. The Senior Secured Notes Issuer will on-lend the net proceeds from these drawings along with funds received from the Senior Notes Issuer under the Senior Financing Proceeds Loan to the Purchaser, to be used as described in "Use of Proceeds." See "Description of _Certain Financing Arrangements."_

Section Title: THE TRANSACTIONS
Subsection Title: The Financing
Subsubsection Title: Utilisation of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility
Subsubsection Text: On the Acquisition Completion Date, the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower expects to draw £950 million under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, which will be on-lent by way of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Proceeds Loan to Midco 2. Midco 2 and its subsidiaries, in turn, will on-lend the net proceeds of the drawing to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer pursuant to a deeply subordinated instrument, to be used as described in "Use of Proceeds." See "Description of Certain _Financing Arrangements—Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility." To secure the Distribution Asset_ Disposal Bridge Facility, certain entities within the ASDA Group will grant first priority mortgages, fixed charges or standard securities, as applicable, over the Warehouse Assets, the Select Retail Assets and, to the extent required thereunder, certain Substitute Retail Assets, as well as first-ranking pledges on the Designated Bank Accounts. Prior to the execution of these mortgages, fixed charges, standard securities and pledges, as applicable, entities within the ASDA Group are expected to enter into lease agreements in respect of the Warehouse Assets, the Select Retail Assets and, to the extent applicable, the Substitute Retail Assets on substantially the terms summarised in "Certain Relationships and Related Party _Transactions―ASDA Leases."_

Section Title: THE TRANSACTIONS
Subsection Title: The Financing
Subsubsection Text: In connection with the Acquisition, the Shareholders and Walmart will cause Bellis TopCo Limited and its subsidiaries to contribute to the equity of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or on-lend to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer pursuant to deeply subordinated instruments approximately £1,280 million in aggregate (the "Equity Contribution"), which includes the proceeds of Walmart's £500 million Rollover Equity Investment and £780 million of funds raised by the Shareholders.

Section Title: THE TRANSACTIONS
Subsection Title: The Financing
Subsubsection Title: The Offering and the repayment of the bridge loans
Subsubsection Text: On the Issue Date, the Senior Notes Issuer will use the proceeds from the Offering of the Senior Notes to repay all amounts outstanding under the Senior Bridge Facility Agreement, and the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will use the proceeds from the Offering of the Senior Secured Notes to repay all amounts outstanding under the Senior Secured Bridge Facilities Agreement. See "Use of Proceeds."

Section Title: THE TRANSACTIONS
Subsection Title: The Financing
Subsubsection Title: Estimated cash and cash equivalents as of the Acquisition Completion Date
Subsubsection Text: On or about the Acquisition Completion Date, ASDA will settle in cash intercompany loans owed to Walmart of £409.0 million. In addition, on December 3, 2020, the Company announced that it will pay in full its business rates for the UK tax year ending April 5, 2021 to the UK government (and the devolved administrations of Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland), thus waiving the relief it had received earlier in 2020 in respect of such payment as part of the UK government's measures in support of UK businesses in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. This is estimated to be within a range of £320 million to £340 million. As a result, the Company expects to pay £254 million in retrospective business rates for the period from April to December 2020, to be funded from cash available on the Company's balance sheet. The Company expects to engage in due course with the competent UK authorities to discuss and agree the exact terms of such payment, including its timing. ASDA also plans to resume its regular payments of the business rates on a monthly basis commencing with the month of January 2021. The Company estimates that its average cash and cash equivalents from January 4 to February 2, 2021 (inclusive), as adjusted to ### 139 ----- give pro forma effect to the consummation of the Transactions on the Acquisition Completion Date and excluding the amount earmarked to retrospectively pay business rates tax relief accepted from the UK government for the period to December 31, 2020 was £505.6 million. ASDA's net working capital for the month of January tends to be slightly lower than the yearly average due to the customary seasonal dip in stock levels and the build-up of trade payables to suppliers in the early part of each financial year following the Christmas trading period. ASDA's actual cash and cash equivalents available as of the Acquisition Completion Date may however be different.

Section Title: THE TRANSACTIONS
Subsection Title: The Financing
Subsubsection Title: The Financing in the event that the Issue Date occurs prior to, or substantially concurrently with, the Acquisition Completion Date
Subsubsection Text: It is possible that the Acquisition Completion Date may be delayed until after the Issue Date, including due to the timing of our receipt of the FCA's approval of the Acquisition. In this case, unless the Offering is settled substantially concurrently with the closing of the Acquisition, we will, pending completion of the Acquisition, fund the gross proceeds of the Offering into Escrow Accounts, which will be held in the name of the relevant Issuer, but controlled by the relevant Escrow Agent, and pledged in favour of the relevant Trustee on behalf of and for the benefit of the holders of the relevant Notes, pursuant to the terms of the Escrow Agreements and Escrow Account Charges dated on or before the Issue Date. Under the terms of the Escrow Agreements, release of the Escrowed Proceeds will be subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions, including the completion of the Acquisition and the solvency of the relevant Issuer. Following release from escrow, we expect to use the proceeds of the Offering, together with the Equity Contribution and amounts drawn under the Senior Facilities, the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility and the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility (as described above and in "Use of Proceeds.") to fund our payment of the Purchase Consideration on the Acquisition Completion Date. In the event we deposit the gross proceeds of the Offering into the Escrow Accounts on the Issue Date and the Acquisition Completion Date has not occurred, or the conditions to the release of such Escrowed Proceeds have not been satisfied, on or before the Outside Date, Midco has not elected to extend the initial Shortfall Agreement Termination Date (or any extension thereof) and the Release has not occurred as at such date or in certain other circumstances, subject to certain conditions, the Notes will be mandatorily redeemable at a price equal to 100% of the aggregate issue price of the Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest from the Issue Date to, but not including, the Special Mandatory Redemption Date and Additional Amounts, if any. If the Offering is settled substantially concurrently with the completion of the Acquisition, we will forgo these escrow procedures and will instead retain the proceeds of the Offering to fund part of the consideration payable under the Acquisition Agreement on the Acquisition Completion Date. See "Use of _Proceeds," "Description of the Senior Notes—Acquisition Agreement, Timing of Completion Date and Issue Date; Escrow of Proceeds" and "Description of the Senior Secured Notes—Acquisition Agreement, Timing of Completion Date and Issue Date; Escrow of Proceeds."_

Section Title: THE TRANSACTIONS
Subsection Title: The Post-Completion Transactions
Subsubsection Title: Warehouse and Other Select Retail Assets Securing the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility
Subsubsection Text: Following the CMA Clearance Date, ASDA will transfer the Warehouse Assets, the balances credited to the Designated Bank Accounts, and to the extent required by the terms of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, Substitute Retail Assets and Select Retail Assets, to Propco 2 or other affiliates who are obligors thereunder (the "Post-Completion Disposals") in exchange for consideration left outstanding (the "Post-Completion Disposal Receivables"). Alternatively, Select Retail Assets and, as relevant, Substitute Retail Assets may remain held by the ASDA Group but will continue to be charged in favour of the lenders under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility as described in the paragraph below. ASDA will agree to subordinate its claims against Propco 2 or such other affiliates to those of lenders under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility pursuant to a separate subordination agreement. The transfers of each of the Warehouse Assets and, to the extent required by the terms of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, Substitute Retail Assets and Select Retail Assets in connection with the Post-Completion Disposals will be subject to the ASDA Leases, which will remain in effect. To the extent any part of a Substitute Retail Asset or a Select Retail Asset comprises a Forecourt Asset, following the CMA Clearance Date, if documents are agreed by such date, that part of the ASDA Lease which comprises the Forecourt Asset will be surrendered (or, as applicable, renounced) and any security affecting that part of the Substitute Retail Asset or the Select Retail Asset which comprises the Forecourt Asset will be released such that the intention is for the Substitute Retail Asset or the Select Retail Asset to be transferred to Propco 2 or its affiliates (to the extent required by the terms of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility) to exclude the title to the Forecourt Asset which will be retained by ASDA by way of a Forecourt Assets Separation. If any relevant Substitute Retail Asset or Select Retail Asset remains held by the ASDA Group at the time of the Forecourt Business Disposal, that part of the ASDA Lease which comprises the Forecourt Asset will be surrendered (or, as applicable, renounced) and any security affecting that part of ### 140 ----- the Substitute Retail Asset or the Select Retail Asset which comprises the Forecourt Asset will be released and the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility will permit the disposal of the Forecourt Asset pursuant to the terms of the Forecourt SPA by way of a Forecourt Assets Separation such that the remaining part of the Substitute Retail Asset or the Select Retail Asset excludes the title to that Forecourt Asset. After the Forecourt Business Disposal has been completed, (to the extent the Post-Completion Disposals were made to Propco 2, rather than to the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower, following the CMA Clearance Date) we expect Midco 2 to transfer Bellis Select Warehouse Holdings Limited ("Propco

Section Title: THE TRANSACTIONS
Subsection Title: 1") to the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower, in consideration of repayment of the
Subsubsection Text: On February 3, 2021, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and Bellis Forecourts Limited entered into the Forecourt SPA, whereby the Senior Secured Notes Issuer undertook to sell to Bellis Forecourts Limited the share capital of Acquisition 2 or any other member of the Bellis Group or a member of the ASDA Group that holds the Forecourt Business, directly or indirectly, following the Acquisition Completion Date, the CMA Clearance Date and completion of the acquisition by Acquisition 2 (or such other company) of the Forecourt Business. Pursuant to a separate agreement, the EG Forecourt SPA, entered into on or about the same date, Property Newco agreed to sell to Euro Garages Limited the share capital of Holdco (owning in turn Bellis Forecourts Limited and therefore the Forecourt Business) promptly upon closing under the Forecourt SPA. Property Newco may assign such separate agreement to the shareholders (i.e., Optima Group S.à r.l. and Able Holdings Limited), who may sell Property Newco itself, rather than Holdco or one of its subsidiaries. In preparation for, and prior to, the closing of the Forecourt SPA, we expect that ASDA will distribute the Forecourt Business to Acquisition 2 as soon as practicable following the CMA Clearance Date. In order to effect the distribution of the Forecourt Business to Acquisition 2 as a dividend in kind, ASDA will have to arrange for the separation of the freehold or leasehold title to its co-located forecourts (comprising the vast majority of the Forecourt Assets) from the parent title currently comprising adjacent store or retail assets or sites by way of a Forecourt Assets Separation and the entities within the ASDA Group that currently hold non-co-located Forecourt Assets will need to distribute such assets to Acquisition 2. We expect that the process of effecting these title separations and distributions to take several months following the Acquisition Completion Date. The headline enterprise value established under the Forecourt SPA, subject to customary working capital adjustments, is £750 million, less the aggregate value of any Excluded Forecourts (and of any other assets relating to the Excluded Forecourts). The consideration will be left outstanding at the closing of the Forecourt SPA (the "Forecourt Disposal Receivable") and we expect it to be ultimately settled in cash and in full promptly following the closing of the EG Forecourt SPA. See "Certain Relationships and Related _Party Transactions—Forecourt SPA." The parties may decide to novate and assign the Forecourt SPA to_ another member of the Bellis Group or a member of the ASDA Group (as seller) and to a member of the EG Group (as buyer), in which case the separate agreement between Property Newco and Euro Garages Limited would be terminated and the Forecourt Business (or a holding company thereof) would be sold directly to EG Group by the ASDA Group. The IEO that is expected to be issued by the CMA will not permit us to sell any Forecourt Assets pursuant to the Forecourt SPA for so long as the IEO remains in force. Consequently, we do not expect to consummate the Forecourt Business Disposal before the CMA Clearance Date. The Forecourt SPA requires us to complete the transactions contemplated thereunder as soon as reasonably practicable following the satisfaction of the conditions precedent stipulated in its terms, which include the IEO to be issued by the CMA ceasing to be in effect. The CMA's investigation of the Acquisition is ongoing, and we may be required to take remedial action to address any competition-related concerns the CMA may identify. If remedies prove necessary, we may be required to designate certain Forecourt Assets (along with certain related assets) as Excluded Forecourts and sell them to unaffiliated third parties (the "Excluded Forecourt Divestments"). Although we will attempt to carry out the Excluded Forecourt Divestments by way of orderly sales following a competitive sales process, there can be no assurance that the market conditions or circumstances of the Excluded Forecourt Divestments will permit such an outcome, and the price we receive for any Excluded Forecourts sold through the Excluded Forecourt Divestments may be less than what we would have ultimately received in a fully voluntary sale. In addition, third parties may have rights over the Forecourt ### 143 ----- Assets (including rights to acquire and pre-emption rights) exercisable in the event of a transfer of the Forecourt Assets (whether of the freehold or leasehold interest or of whole or part). In all such cases, the transfer of those Forecourt Assets may be significantly delayed, prevented in part or prevented entirely. See "Risk Factors—Risks Relating to the Transactions—The Acquisition is subject to certain uncertainties _and risks, which could adversely impact recoveries under the Notes."_ Under the terms of the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility, the proceeds from the sale of both the Forecourt Business Disposal and the Excluded Forecourt Divestment must be used to repay amounts outstanding under the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility until it has been repaid in full. See "Description _of Certain Financing Arrangements—Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility."_ ### 144 -----

Section Title: THE TRANSACTIONS
Subsection Title: 1") to the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower, in consideration of repayment of the
Subsubsection Text: outstanding balance of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Proceeds Loan. Please see "Summary Corporate and Financing Structure." Because certain third-party consents, approvals or certifications in relation to the grant of an ASDA Lease, the grant of Third-Party Asset Security in respect of one or more Warehouse Assets or, in each case, the registration of any such ASDA Lease or grant of Third-Party Asset Security may remain outstanding at a cut-off point prior to the Acquisition Completion Date, entities in the ASDA Group owning such Warehouse Assets may not be able to grant an ASDA Lease or grant Third-Party Asset Security in respect of such Warehouse Assets at the relevant time. In this case, on or about the Acquisition Completion Date, entities in the ASDA Group will enter into ASDA Leases in respect of one of more Substitute Retail Assets with an aggregate value approximately equal to the aggregate value of the Affected Warehouse Assets and grant Third-Party Asset Security over such Substitute Retail Assets to secure the obligations of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. In the event that the Land Registry (or jurisdictional equivalent) will not register any Third-Party Asset Security because a deed of covenant is not in the prescribed form due to changes required by the security agent under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility or third-party authorisations are outstanding (in each case in respect of a Warehouse Asset), then an ASDA Lease will be granted instead in respect of a Substitute Retail Asset of approximately equivalent value and ThirdParty Security will be granted over such Substitute Retail Asset. See "The Transactions—Post-Completion _Transactions—Warehouse and Other Select Retail Assets Securing the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility." If, prior to the CMA Clearance Date, outstanding third-party consents, approvals or certifications_ are received to permit the grant of an ASDA Lease, the grant of Third-Party Asset Security or the registration of either of the following (as the case may be) in respect of any Affected Warehouse Asset, entities in the ASDA Group will enter into an ASDA Lease in respect of such Affected Warehouse Asset (to the extent not already entered into) and grant Third-Party Asset Security over such Affected Warehouse Asset (to the extent not already granted) to secure the obligations of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. Third-Party Asset Security which was granted on or about the Acquisition Completion Date over one or more Substitute Retail Assets with an aggregate value approximately equal to the value of that Affected Warehouse Asset will then be released and discharged, subject to the Third-Party Asset Security in respect of that Affected Warehouse Asset being successfully registered at the Land Registry (or its jurisdictional equivalent) in favour of lenders under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. If, following the CMA Clearance Date, requisite third-party consents, approvals or certifications in relation to the transfer of one or more Warehouse Assets (in respect of which either an ASDA Lease and Third-Party Asset Security have been granted or an ASDA Lease has been granted and requisite thirdparty consents, approvals or certifications in relation to the grant of any first-ranking legal mortgages, fixed charges or, as applicable, standard securities to be granted by Propco 2 or other affiliates (and the registration of the foregoing) have been obtained) pursuant to the Post-Completion Disposals or the registration of any transfer in respect of such Warehouse Assets remain outstanding, entities in the ASDA Group will enter into ASDA Leases in respect of one of more Substitute Retail Assets with an aggregate value approximately equal to the aggregate value of such Affected Warehouse Assets. Entities in the ASDA Group that own such Substitute Retail Assets will grant Third-Party Asset Security in respect of such Substitute Retail Assets. To the extent required by the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, such Substitute Retail Assets will be transferred to Propco 2 or other affiliates pursuant to the PostCompletion Disposals to secure the obligations of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. Alternatively, such assets may remain held by the ASDA Group but continue to be charged in favour of the lenders under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. If, following the date of the Post-Completion Disposals, outstanding third-party consents, approvals or certifications are received to permit the grant of an ASDA Lease, the transfer to and the grant of first-ranking legal mortgages, fixed charges or, as applicable, standard securities (to the extent that Affected Warehouse Asset is not transferred subject to existing Third-Party Asset Security) by Propco 2 or other affiliates in respect of that Affected Warehouse Asset, entities in the ASDA Group will enter into an ASDA Lease in respect of that Affected Warehouse Asset (to the extent not already entered into) and transfer the Affected Warehouse Asset to Propco 2 or other affiliates, which will grant (unless the Affected ### 141 ----- Warehouse Asset is transferred subject to existing Third-Party Asset Security) a first-ranking legal mortgage, fixed charge or, as applicable, standard security in respect of it to secure the obligations of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. First-ranking legal mortgages, fixed charges or, as applicable, standard securities which were granted over one or more Substitute Retail Assets with an aggregate value approximately equal to the value of that Affected Warehouse Asset will then be released and discharged, subject to the first-ranking legal mortgages, fixed charge or, as applicable, standard security in respect of that Affected Warehouse Asset being successfully registered at the Land Registry (or its jurisdictional equivalent) in favour of lenders under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. See "The Transactions—Post-Completion _Transactions—Warehouse and Other Select Retail Assets Securing the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility."_ If outstanding third-party consents, approvals or certifications are received following the CMA Clearance Date to permit the grant of an ASDA Lease and the transfer of an Affected Warehouse Asset to Propco 2 or other affiliates, but not the grant of a first-ranking legal mortgage, fixed charge or, as applicable, standard security in respect of that Affected Warehouse Asset to secure the obligations of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, such Affected Warehouse Asset may nevertheless be transferred to Propco 2 or other affiliates. If, following such transfer, outstanding third-party consents, approvals or certifications are received to permit the grant of first-ranking legal mortgages, fixed charges or, as applicable, standard securities by Propco 2 or other affiliates, and the registration of the foregoing in respect of that Affected Warehouse Asset, Propco 2 or other affiliates will grant a first-ranking legal mortgage, fixed charge or, as applicable, standard security in respect of them to secure the obligations of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. First-ranking legal mortgages, fixed charges or, as applicable, standard securities which were granted over one or more Substitute Retail Assets with an aggregate value approximately equal to the value of that Affected Warehouse Asset will then be released and discharged, subject to the first-ranking legal mortgage, fixed charge or, as applicable, standard security in respect of that Affected Warehouse Asset being successfully registered at the Land Registry (or its jurisdictional equivalent) in favour of lenders under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. If following the transfer of a Warehouse Asset, Select Retail Asset and/or Substitute Retail Asset to Propco 2 or other affiliates, the ASDA Lease granted in respect of such asset is not held by ASL, the relevant tenant is required under the terms of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Agreement to assign the ASDA Lease to ASL with the intent that all ASDA Leases in respect of Warehouse Assets, Select Retail Assets and Substitute Retail Assets held by Propco 2 or other affiliates are held by ASL. If, following the transfer of a Substitute Retail Asset to Propco 2 or other affiliates, first-ranking legal mortgages, fixed charges or, as applicable, standard securities which were granted over that Substitute Retail Asset are released, Propco 2 or other affiliates may transfer such Substitute Retail Asset to the ASDA Group in advance of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility being repaid in full. The initial term of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility is one year from the Acquisition Completion Date, with the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower retaining an option to extend it for a further six months at its own discretion. The Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility has no scheduled amortisation and we intend to repay it in full ahead of maturity primarily with the net proceeds from the Warehouse Sale Transactions we expect to consummate before and after the transfer of Bellis Select Warehouse Holdings Limited to the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower, which would have to be applied promptly in mandatory prepayment of the facility. Depending on market conditions and expected transaction values, the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower or Propco 2, as applicable, may also sell some or all of the Select Retail Assets and, to the extent applicable, some or all of the Substitute Retail Assets (in each case subject to ASDA Leases), the proceeds of which would also have to be applied in mandatory prepayment of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. We anticipate that the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower (or Propco 2, as may be the case) will return to the Issuers, by way of contribution to their equity, in-kind loan pursuant to a deeply subordinated instrument or repayment of Post-Completion Disposal Receivables held by the Group, any Select Retail Assets and Substitute Retail Assets that it does not sell to repay the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, and, to the extent such proceeds are not used to repay amounts outstanding under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, amounts equal to any net proceeds directly or indirectly received from the sale of any Select Retail Assets and Substitute Retail Assets (including any Retail Asset Disposal Proceeds) (the "Retail Assets Contributions"). After the Retail Assets Contributions have been made, we expect to distribute any remaining Post-Completion Disposal Receivables to Topco, in the amounts that remain outstanding at the time, by way of dividends in kind and anticipate that Topco would then arrange for such receivables to be extinguished by contribution to Propco 2. Subject to certain limitations, the Post-Completion Disposals and the in-kind distribution of the Post ### 142 ----- Completion Receivables will be permitted by the Indentures and the Senior Facilities Agreement notwithstanding the restrictive covenants or other terms that would otherwise apply to such transactions. Moreover, these distributions will not constitute Restricted Payments under the Indentures and the Senior Facilities Agreement and will not reduce the Issuers' capacity to make distributions or pay dividends in the future. See "Description of the Senior Secured Notes—General—Restricted Subsidiaries and Unrestricted _Subsidiaries; Extraction of Warehouse Assets and Select Retail Assets" and "Description of the Senior Notes—General—Restricted Subsidiaries and Unrestricted Subsidiaries; Extraction of Warehouse Assets and Select Retail Assets."_ In connection with sale transactions entered into by the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower, we may be required to amend the terms of the ASDA Leases. Such amendments will be permitted under the Indentures and the Senior Facilities Agreement, subject to compliance with the covenants described in "Description of the Senior Secured Notes—Certain Covenants—Limitation on _Affiliate Transactions" and "Description of the Senior Notes—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Affiliate Transactions."_

Subsection Title: Use of proceeds in the event that the Issue Date occurs prior to the Acquisition Completion Date
Subsubsection Text: We estimate that the gross proceeds from the Offering will be £2,750 million. If the Offering is consummated prior to, and not substantially concurrently with, the Acquisition Completion Date, pending consummation of the Acquisition, the Initial Purchasers will deposit, on the Issue Date, an amount in cash equal to the gross proceeds of the Offering into the Escrow Accounts, which will be held in the name of the relevant Issuer, but controlled by the relevant Escrow Agent, and pledged in favour of the relevant Trustee on behalf of and for the benefit of the holders of the relevant Notes, pursuant to the terms of the relevant Escrow Agreement. Upon release from the Escrow Accounts on or about the Acquisition Completion Date, the gross proceeds from the Offering, the Equity Contribution (including Walmart's Rollover Equity Investment) and amounts drawn under the Senior Facilities, the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility, the Senior Bridge Facility, the Senior Secured Bridge Facilities and the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility will be used to (i) pay the consideration and make other payments owing to Walmart under the Acquisition Agreement and (ii) pay fees, costs and expenses incurred in connection with the Transactions (including estimated fees and expenses to be incurred in connection with the Offering). If the Offering closes substantially concurrently with the completion of the Acquisition, and we will retain the proceeds of the Offering and apply them on the Acquisition Completion Date as described above and shown in the table below.
