"Significant Subsidiary" means any Restricted Subsidiary that meets any of the following conditions: (1) the Senior Secured Notes Issuer's and its Restricted Subsidiaries' proportionate share of the total assets (after intercompany eliminations) of the Restricted Subsidiary exceeds 10% of the total assets of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries on a consolidated basis as of the end of the most recently completed fiscal year; or (2) the Senior Secured Notes Issuer's and its Restricted Subsidiaries' proportionate share of the Consolidated EBITDA of the Restricted Subsidiary exceeds 10% of the Consolidated EBITDA of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries on a consolidated basis for the most recently completed fiscal year. "Similar Business" means (a) any businesses, services or activities engaged in by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or any of its Subsidiaries or any Associates on either the Issue Date or the Completion Date and (b) any businesses, services and activities that are related, complementary, incidental, ancillary or similar to any of the foregoing or are extensions or developments of any thereof. "Specified Short-term Working Capital Lines" means Short-term Working Capital Lines up to a maximum aggregate principal amount at any time outstanding not exceeding the greater of (x) £360 million and (y) 30% of Consolidated EBITDA. "Standard Securitisation Undertakings" means representations, warranties, covenants, guarantees and indemnities entered into by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or any Subsidiary of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer which the Senior Secured Notes Issuer has determined in good faith to be customary in a Securitisation Facility, including those relating to the servicing of the assets of a Securitisation Subsidiary, it being understood that any Securitisation Repurchase Obligation shall be deemed to be a Standard Securitisation Undertaking. "Stated Maturity" means, with respect to any Indebtedness, the date specified in such Indebtedness as the fixed date on which the payment of principal of such Indebtedness is due and payable, including pursuant to any mandatory redemption provision, but shall not include any contingent obligations, including obligations similar to those described in "—Change of Control" or the covenant under "—Certain _Covenants—Limitation on Sales of Assets and Subsidiary Stock," to repay, redeem or repurchase any_ such principal prior to the date originally scheduled for the payment thereof. "Sterling Equivalent" means, with respect to any monetary amount in a currency other than sterling, at any time of determination thereof by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or the Trustee, the amount of sterling obtained by converting such currency other than sterling involved in such computation into sterling 374 ----- at the spot rate for the purchase of sterling with the applicable currency other than sterling as published in _The Financial Times in the "Currency Rates" section (or, if The Financial Times is no longer published, or_ if such information is no longer available in The Financial Times, such source as may be selected in good faith by the Board of Directors or a member of Senior Management) on the date of such determination. "Subordinated Indebtedness" means any Indebtedness of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or any Guarantor (whether outstanding on the Issue Date or thereafter Incurred) that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Senior Secured Notes or the relevant Notes Guarantee pursuant to a written agreement, including, without limitation, Indebtedness of any Guarantor that is designated as a "Topco Liability" under the Intercreditor Agreement. "Subordinated Shareholder Funding" means, collectively, any funds provided to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer by any Parent, any Affiliate of any Parent or any Permitted Holder or any Affiliate thereof, in exchange for or pursuant to any security, instrument or agreement other than Capital Stock, in each case issued to and held by any of the foregoing Persons, together with any such security, instrument or agreement and any other security or instrument other than Capital Stock issued in payment of any obligation under any Subordinated Shareholder Funding; provided that such Subordinated Shareholder Funding: (1) does not mature or require any amortisation, redemption or other repayment of principal or any sinking fund payment prior to the first anniversary of the Stated Maturity of the Senior Secured Notes (other than through conversion or exchange of such funding into Capital Stock (other than Disqualified Stock) of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or any funding meeting the requirements of this definition) or the making of any such payment prior to the first anniversary of the Stated Maturity of the Senior Secured Notes is restricted by the Intercreditor Agreement, an Additional Intercreditor Agreement or another intercreditor agreement; (2) does not require, prior to the first anniversary of the Stated Maturity of the Senior Secured Notes, payment of cash interest, cash withholding amounts or other cash gross-ups, or any similar cash amounts or the making of any such payment prior to the first anniversary of the Stated Maturity of the Senior Secured Notes is restricted by the Intercreditor Agreement or an Additional Intercreditor Agreement; (3) contains no change of control or similar provisions and does not accelerate and has no right to declare a default or event of default or take any enforcement action or otherwise require any cash payment, in each case, prior to the first anniversary of the Stated Maturity of the Senior Secured Notes or the payment of any amount as a result of any such action or provision or the exercise of any rights or enforcement action, in each case, prior to the first anniversary of the Stated Maturity of the Senior Secured Notes is restricted by the Intercreditor Agreement or an Additional Intercreditor Agreement; (4) does not provide for or require any security interest or encumbrance over any asset of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or any of its Subsidiaries; and (5) pursuant to its terms or to the Intercreditor Agreement, an Additional Intercreditor Agreement or another intercreditor agreement, is fully subordinated and junior in right of payment to the Senior Secured Notes pursuant to subordination, payment blockage and enforcement limitation terms which are customary in all material respects for similar funding or are no less favourable in any material respect to Holders than those contained in the Intercreditor Agreement as in effect on the Issue Date with respect to "Subordinated Liabilities" (as defined therein). "Subordination Agreement" means the agreement to be entered into (substantially concurrently with Post-Completion Disposals) by or on behalf of the lenders under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility and the parties to any Post-Completion Disposal Receivables, whereby the Post-Completion Disposal Receivables will be subordinated in right of payment to the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. "Subsidiary" means, with respect to any Person: (1) any corporation, association, or other business entity (other than a partnership, joint venture, limited company, limited liability company or similar entity) of which more than 50% of the total voting power of shares of Capital Stock entitled (without regard to the occurrence of any contingency) to vote in the election of directors, managers or trustees thereof is, at the time of determination, owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by such Person or one or more of the other Subsidiaries of that Person or a combination thereof; or (2) any partnership, joint venture, limited company, limited liability company or similar entity of which: (a) more than 50% of the capital accounts, distribution rights, total equity and voting interests or general or limited partnership interests, as applicable, are owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by 375 ----- such Person or one or more of the other Subsidiaries of that Person or a combination thereof whether in the form of membership, general, special or limited partnership interests or otherwise; and (b) such Person or any Subsidiary of such Person is a controlling general partner or otherwise controls such entity. "Substitute Retail Assets" means the retail assets listed in an annex to the Senior Secured Notes Indenture captioned "Substitute Retail Assets," and any related Retail Asset Disposal Proceeds, insurance policies (or proceeds of such policies), rental income and other gross disposal proceeds; provided that any such asset or proceeds shall never cease to be a Substitute Retail Asset for the purposes of determining what property constitutes "Material Real Property," but shall otherwise cease to be a Substitute Retail Asset (a) except for purposes of the covenant described under "Certain Covenants—Topco Covenant," upon the completion of any Post-Completion Disposal with respect to such asset or proceeds, (b) for purposes of the covenant described under "Certain Covenants—Topco Covenant," upon the completion of any Retail Assets Contribution with respect to such asset or proceeds or (c) upon the repayment or refinancing in full of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, if held by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries at such time. "Successor Holding Company" with respect to any Person means any other Person with more than 50% of the total voting power of the Voting Stock of which is, at the time the first Person becomes a Subsidiary of such other Person, "beneficially owned" (as defined below) by one or more Persons that "beneficially owned" (as defined below) more than 50% of the total voting power of the Voting Stock of the first Person immediately prior to the first Person becoming a Subsidiary of such other Person. For purposes hereof, "beneficially own" has the meaning correlative to the term "beneficial owner," as such term is defined in Rules 13d-3 and 13d-5 under the Exchange Act (as in effect on the Issue Date). "Syndicated Term Facilities" means any debt facility with banks or other institutional lenders providing for term loans that are underwritten or arranged by mandated arrangers with the primary goal of being distributed and broadly syndicated to institutional investors in the international syndication loan markets. For the avoidance of doubt and without limitation: (1) revolving credit facilities; (2) bilateral facilities; and (3) club credit facilities provided by relationship banks will not be deemed to be Syndicated Term Facilities. "Tax Sharing Agreement" means any fiscal unity, tax consolidation, tax sharing agreement, profit and loss pooling arrangement or similar arrangement, that is entered into with or established by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, any Parent and/or any Subsidiary (including pursuant to one or more elections or filings with relevant tax authorities), as the same may be amended, supplemented, waived or otherwise modified from time to time in accordance with the terms thereof and the Senior Secured Notes Indenture, and any arrangements, payments or transactions made between the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and/or any of its Subsidiaries and/or any Parent in order to satisfy the obligations arising under any such fiscal unity, tax consolidation or other arrangement. "Taxes" means all present and future taxes, levies, imposts, deductions, charges, duties and withholdings and any charges of a similar nature (including interest and penalties with respect thereto) that are imposed by any government or other taxing authority. "Temporary Cash Investments" means any of the following: (1) any investment in: (a) direct obligations of, or obligations Guaranteed by, (i) the United States of America or Canada, (ii) a Permissible Jurisdiction, (iii) Switzerland or Norway, (iv) any country in whose currency funds are being held specifically pending application in the making of an investment or capital expenditure by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary in that country with such funds or (v) any agency or instrumentality of any such country or member state; or (b) direct obligations of any country recognised by the United States of America rated at least "A" by S&P or "A-2" by Moody's (or, in either case, the equivalent of such rating by such organisation or, if no rating of S&P or Moody's then exists, the equivalent of such rating by any Nationally Recognised Statistical Rating Organisation); (2) overnight bank deposits, and investments in time deposit accounts, certificates of deposit, bankers' acceptances and money market deposits (or, with respect to foreign banks, similar instruments) maturing not more than one year after the date of acquisition thereof issued by: (a) any lender under the Senior Credit Facilities; (b) any institution authorised to operate as a bank in any of the countries or member states referred to in sub clause (1)(a) above; or 376 ----- (c) any bank or trust company organised under the laws of any such country or member state or any political subdivision thereof, in each case, having capital and surplus aggregating in excess of £250 million (or the foreign currency equivalent thereof) and whose long-term debt is rated at least "A" by S&P or "A-2" by Moody's (or, in either case, the equivalent of such rating by such organisation or, if no rating of S&P or Moody's then exists, the equivalent of such rating by any Nationally Recognised Statistical Rating Organisation) at the time such Investment is made; (3) repurchase obligations with a term of not more than 30 days for underlying securities of the types described in clause (1) or (2) above entered into with a Person meeting the qualifications described in clause (2) above; (4) Investments in commercial paper, maturing not more than 270 days after the date of acquisition, issued by a Person (other than the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or any of its Subsidiaries), with a rating at the time as of which any Investment therein is made of "P-2" (or higher) according to Moody's or "A-2" (or higher) according to S&P (or, in either case, the equivalent of such rating by such organisation or, if no rating of S&P or Moody's then exists, the equivalent of such rating by any Nationally Recognised Statistical Rating Organisation); (5) Investments in securities maturing not more than one year after the date of acquisition issued or fully Guaranteed by any state, commonwealth or territory of the United States of America, Canada, a Permissible Jurisdiction or Switzerland, Norway or by any political subdivision or taxing authority of any such state, commonwealth, territory, country or member state, and rated at least "BBB-" by S&P or "Baa3" by Moody's (or, in either case, the equivalent of such rating by such organisation or, if no rating of S&P or Moody's then exists, the equivalent of such rating by any Nationally Recognised Statistical Rating Organisation); (6) bills of exchange issued in the United States, Canada, a Permissible Jurisdiction, Switzerland, Norway or Japan eligible for rediscount at the relevant central bank and accepted by a bank (or any dematerialised equivalent); (7) any money market deposit accounts issued or offered by a commercial bank organised under the laws of a country that is a member of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, in each case, having capital and surplus in excess of £250 million (or the foreign currency equivalent thereof) or whose long-term debt is rated at least "A" by S&P or "A2" by Moody's (or, in either case, the equivalent of such rating by such organisation or, if no rating of S&P or Moody's then exists, the equivalent of such rating by any Nationally Recognised Statistical Rating Organisation) at the time such Investment is made; (8) investment funds investing 95% of their assets in securities of the type described in clauses (1) through (7) above (which funds may also hold reasonable amounts of cash pending investment or distribution); and (9) investments in money market funds complying with the risk limiting conditions of Rule 2a-7 (or any successor rule) of the SEC under the U.S. Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended. "Topco" means Bellis Topco Limited and its successors and assigns. "Trade Payables" means, with respect to any Person, any accounts payable or any indebtedness or monetary obligation to trade creditors created, assumed or guaranteed by such Person arising in the ordinary course of business in connection with the acquisition of goods or services, as amended or extended from time to time. "Transactions" means the transactions described in this Offering Memorandum under the caption "The _Transactions," including, but not limited to, the Financing Transactions, the Acquisition Transactions, the_ drawing of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, the Subordination Agreement, the PostCompletion Disposals, the Affiliate Sale and Leaseback Transactions, the Forecourt SPA, the direct or indirect transfer of the Forecourt Business to EG Group Limited or one of its Subsidiaries (including pursuant to the Forecourt SPA), any Forecourt Assets Separation, and any other transaction or intermediate step reasonably necessary to consummate any of the foregoing. "U.S. GAAP" means generally accepted accounting principles in the United States of America as in effect from time to time. "UK Government Obligations" means direct obligations of, or obligations guaranteed by, the United Kingdom, and the payment for which the United Kingdom pledges its full faith and credit. "Uniform Commercial Code" means the New York Uniform Commercial Code, as amended. 377 ----- "Unrestricted Subsidiary" means: (1) any Subsidiary of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer that at the time of determination is an Unrestricted Subsidiary (as designated by the Board of Directors of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer in the manner provided below); and (2) any Subsidiary of an Unrestricted Subsidiary. The Board of Directors of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer may designate any Subsidiary of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer (including any newly acquired or newly formed Subsidiary or a Person becoming a Subsidiary through merger, consolidation or other business combination transaction, or Investment therein) to be an Unrestricted Subsidiary only if: (1) such Subsidiary or any of its Subsidiaries does not own any Capital Stock or Indebtedness of, or own or hold any Lien on any property of, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or any other Subsidiary of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, in each case which is not a Subsidiary of the Subsidiary to be so designated or otherwise an Unrestricted Subsidiary; and (2) such designation and the Investment of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer in such Subsidiary complies with "—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Restricted Payments." Any such designation by the Board of Directors of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer shall be evidenced to the Trustee by promptly providing the Trustee with a copy of the resolution of the Board of Directors of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer giving effect to such designation and an Officer's Certificate certifying that such designation complies with the foregoing conditions. The Board of Directors of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer may designate any Unrestricted Subsidiary to be a Restricted Subsidiary; provided that, immediately after giving effect to such designation, (1) no Default or Event of Default would result therefrom and (2)(x) the Senior Secured Notes Issuer could Incur at least £1.00 of additional Indebtedness under the first paragraph of the covenant described under "— _Certain Covenants—Limitation on Indebtedness" or (y) the Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio would not be_ less than it was immediately prior to giving effect to such designation, in each case, on a pro forma basis taking into account such designation. Any such designation by the Board of Directors shall be evidenced to the Trustee by promptly providing the Trustee with a copy of the resolution of the Board of Directors giving effect to such designation or an Officer's Certificate certifying that such designation complied with the foregoing provisions. "Voting Stock" of a Person means all classes of Capital Stock of such Person then outstanding and normally entitled to vote in the election of directors. "Warehouse Assets" means the warehouse assets listed in an annex to the Senior Secured Notes Indenture captioned "Warehouse Assets," and any related insurance policies (or proceeds of such policies), rental income and gross disposal proceeds; provided that any such asset shall never cease to be a Warehouse Asset for the purposes of determining what property constitutes "Material Real Property," but shall otherwise cease to be a Warehouse Asset upon the completion of any Post-Completion Disposal with respect to such asset. "Wholly Owned Subsidiary" means a Restricted Subsidiary, all of the Capital Stock of which (other than directors' qualifying shares or shares required by any applicable law or regulation to be held by a Person other than the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or another Wholly Owned Subsidiary) is owned by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or another Wholly Owned Subsidiary. 378 -----

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: _You will find definitions of certain capitalised terms used in this "Description of the Senior Secured Notes" under the heading "Certain Definitions." For purposes of this "Description of the Senior Secured Notes," references to the "Senior Secured Notes Issuer," "we," "our," and "us" refer only to Bellis Acquisition Company plc and not to any of its Subsidiaries._ The Senior Secured Notes Issuer will issue £2,250 million aggregate principal amount of sterlingdenominated % Senior Secured Notes due 2026 (the "Senior Secured Notes") under an indenture, to be dated as of, 2021 (the "Senior Secured Notes Indenture"), between, _inter alios, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, Deutsche Trustee Company Limited, as trustee (the_ "Trustee"), Deutsche Bank AG, London Branch, as security agent (the "Security Agent"), Deutsche Bank AG, London Branch, as paying agent, and Deutsche Bank Luxembourg S.A. as transfer agent (the "Transfer Agent") and registrar (the "Registrar"), in a private transaction that is not subject to the registration requirements of the Securities Act. The Senior Secured Notes Indenture will not be qualified under, incorporate by reference or include terms of, or be subject to, any of the provisions of the U.S. Trust Indenture Act of 1939, as amended. The Senior Secured Notes Indenture will be unlimited in aggregate principal amount. £2,250 million in aggregate principal amount of Senior Secured Notes will be issued in this offering. We may, subject to applicable law, issue an unlimited principal amount of additional Senior Secured Notes (the "Additional

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR NOTES
Subsection Title: Agent"), Deutsche Bank AG, London Branch, as paying agent, and Deutsche Bank Luxembourg S.A. as
Subsubsection Text: transfer agent (the "Transfer Agent") and registrar (the "Registrar"), in a private transaction that is not subject to the registration requirements of the Securities Act. The Senior Notes Indenture will not be qualified under, incorporate by reference or include terms of, or be subject to, any of the provisions of the U.S. Trust Indenture Act of 1939, as amended. The Senior Notes Indenture will be unlimited in aggregate principal amount. £500 million in aggregate principal amount of Senior Notes will be issued in this offering. We may, subject to applicable law, issue an unlimited principal amount of additional Senior Notes (the "Additional Senior Notes") of the same or different series as the Senior Notes initially issued on the Issue Date, which shall have substantially identical terms to the initial Senior Notes, except for certain terms which may be specifically distinguished in an Officer's Certificate; _provided, that if the Additional Senior Notes are not fungible with the Senior Notes for U.S. federal income tax purposes, the Additional Senior Notes will be issued with a separate ISIN code, Common Code or other securities identification number, as applicable, from the Senior Notes. We will only be permitted to issue Additional Senior Notes in compliance with the covenants contained in the Senior Notes Indenture, including the covenants restricting the Incurrence of Indebtedness and the Incurrence of Liens (as described below under "—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Indebtedness" and "—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Liens"). Except with respect to right of payment and optional redemption, and as otherwise provided for in the Senior Notes Indenture, the Senior Notes issued in this Offering and, if issued, any Additional Senior Notes will be treated as a single class for all purposes under the Senior Notes Indenture, including, without limitation, with respect to waivers, amendments, redemptions and offers to purchase. Unless the context otherwise requires, in this "Description of the _Senior Notes," references to the "Senior Notes" include the Senior Notes and any Additional Senior Notes_ that are actually issued. The Senior Notes Indenture will be subject to the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement and any Additional Intercreditor Agreements (as defined below). The terms of the Intercreditor Agreement are important to understanding the terms and ranking of the Senior Notes and the Liens on the Collateral securing the Senior Notes. Please see "Description of Certain Financing Arrangements—Intercreditor _Agreement" for a description of the material terms of the Intercreditor Agreement._ The registered Holder of a Senior Note will be treated as the owner of it for all purposes. Only registered Holders will have rights under the Senior Notes Indenture, including, without limitation, with respect to enforcement and the pursuit of other remedies. The Senior Notes have not been, and will not be, registered under the Securities Act and are subject to certain transfer restrictions. This "Description of the Senior Notes" is intended to be an overview of the material provisions of the Senior Notes, the Senior Notes Indenture and the Security Documents. Since this description of the terms of the Senior Notes is only a summary, you should refer to the Senior Notes, the Senior Notes Indenture and the Security Documents for complete descriptions of the obligations of the Senior Notes Issuer and your rights. Copies of such documents are available from us upon request, and following the Issue Date, copies of such documents will be made available upon request to holders of Senior Notes, as described in more detail under "Listing and General Information."

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR NOTES
Subsection Title: Acquisition Agreement; Timing of Completion Date and Issue Date; Escrow of Proceeds
Subsubsection Text: Pursuant to the acquisition agreement dated October 2, 2020 (the "Acquisition Agreement") between Bellis Acquisition Company 3 Limited, an indirect subsidiary of the Senior Notes Issuer formed for the purpose of facilitating the Transactions (the "Purchaser"), and ASDA Holdings UK Limited, the Purchaser agreed to acquire all of the issued ordinary shares of the Company. We intend to settle the Offering on          , 2021 (the "Issue Date"), which we currently expect to be after the date of consummation of the Acquisition (the "Completion Date"). In this case, on the Completion Date, the Issuers are expected to draw £700 million (equivalent) in loans under the Senior Bridge Facility and £1,400 million (equivalent) in loans under the Senior Secured Bridge Facilities, to fund part of the consideration payable under the Acquisition Agreement. On the Issue Date, we will then use 379 ----- the proceeds of the offering of the Senior Notes together with the proceeds from the offering of the Senior Secured Notes to repay all amounts outstanding under the Senior Bridge Facility and the Senior Secured Bridge Facilities. See "Use of Proceeds." In this case, on the Issue Date, the Senior Notes will be obligations of the Senior Notes Issuer and will be guaranteed on a senior subordinated basis by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, the Company and ASDA Stores Limited (the "Initial Guarantors"). It is, however, possible that the Completion Date may be delayed until after the Issue Date, including due to the timing of our receipt of the FCA's approval of the Acquisition. In this case, unless the Offering is completed substantially concurrently with the Completion Date, we will fund the gross proceeds of the Offering into escrow, as further described below and, on the Issue Date, the Senior Notes will be obligations of the Senior Notes Issuer only and will not be guaranteed on a senior subordinated basis by the Initial Guarantors until the Completion Date. In such circumstances, the Company and its Subsidiaries will continue to be controlled by Walmart prior the Completion Date. We cannot assure you that Walmart will operate ASDA's business during the interim period in the same way that the Senior Notes Issuer would and we cannot assure you that, following the Completion Date, the Company will operate its business in the same way that Walmart has operated the business in the past. As such, we cannot assure you that, prior to the Completion Date, the Company and its Subsidiaries will not engage in activities that would otherwise have been prohibited by the Senior Notes Indenture, had those covenants been applicable to such entities after the Issue Date and prior to the Completion Date. If this Offering is settled substantially concurrently with the Acquisition, we will forego the escrow procedures described above and will instead retain the proceeds of the Offering to fund part of the consideration payable under the Acquisition Agreement on the Completion Date. See "Use of Proceeds." In any event, as contemplated by the Acquisition Agreement, the Acquisition will be completed during the pendency of the review of the Acquisition by the CMA, and the CMA's review remains ongoing. In connection with its review of the Acquisition, the CMA is expected to issue an IEO, which we expect to remain in force until the CMA Clearance Date. Under this IEO, neither the Senior Notes Issuer nor any Parent will be permitted to exercise control over the Company and its Subsidiaries or otherwise direct their operations until the CMA Clearance Date. Accordingly, the Senior Notes Issuer and its Parents will not be able to direct the Company and its Subsidiaries to comply with the covenants described in this "Description _of the Senior Notes" until the CMA Clearance Date, and the Company and its material subsidiaries will_ have no contractual obligation to comply with these covenants until each of these entities accedes to Senior Notes Indenture on the applicable date, which will be on or after the Completion Date. Nevertheless, the covenants described herein will apply to the Company and its Restricted Subsidiaries from the later of the Issue Date and the Completion Date, and any failure to comply with these covenants will constitute a Default under the Senior Notes Indenture. _Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory Redemption_ If the Offering is consummated prior to, and not substantially concurrently with or after, the Completion Date, the Initial Purchasers will deposit, on the Issue Date, an amount in cash equal to the gross proceeds of this offering and sale of the Senior Notes on the Issue Date into one or more escrow accounts (such proceeds, the "Escrowed Proceeds" and such accounts, collectively, the "Escrow Accounts") pursuant to the terms of one or more escrow agreements (each an "Escrow Agreement" and together, the "Escrow

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR NOTES
Subsection Title: Agreements") to be dated as of the Issue Date among the Senior Notes Issuer, the Trustee and Deutsche
Subsubsection Text: Bank AG, London Branch (in such capacity, the "Escrow Agent"). The Escrowed Proceeds deposited in each of the Escrow Accounts will be held in the name of the Senior Notes Issuer, but will be controlled by the Escrow Agent. The Escrowed Proceeds, and all other funds and payments credited to the Escrow Accounts (less any property and/or funds released in accordance with each Escrow Agreement) are referred to, collectively, as the "Escrowed Property." The Senior Notes Issuer's rights with respect to the Escrow Accounts, together with the Escrowed Property, will be pledged in favour of the Trustee on behalf of, and for the benefit of, the Holders of Senior Notes on the Issue Date (such charges to be documented under one or more English law governed security agreements (the "Escrow Account Charges") among the Senior Notes Issuer and the Trustee to be dated on or before the Issue Date). Under the terms of the Escrow Agreements, amounts may be released from the Escrow Accounts prior to the Completion Date to pay accrued interest on the Senior Notes on any interest payment date in respect thereof occurring prior to the Escrow Release Date. Each Holder, by accepting a Senior Note, shall be deemed to have agreed to and accepted the terms and conditions of the applicable Escrow Agreement or Escrow Agreements, as applicable, and the Escrow Account Charges and to have irrevocably authorised and directed the Trustee and the Escrow Agent to take all actions set forth in the Escrow Agreements in the event it is executed without the need for further 380 ----- direction from them under the Senior Notes Indenture. Changes or other modifications to the Escrow Agreements and the Escrow Account Charges can be made either with the consent of Holders of at least a majority in aggregate principal amount of the applicable series of Senior Notes then outstanding or without the consent of Holders, if such changes or other modifications will not, individually or when taken as whole, adversely affect the rights of any Holder in any material respect. _Release of Escrowed Proceeds in connection with the consummation of Acquisition_ In order to cause the Escrow Agent to release the Escrowed Property to, or to pay it at the instruction of, the Senior Notes Issuer (the "Release"), the Escrow Agent and the Trustee shall have received from the Senior Notes Issuer, at a time that is on or before April 30, 2022 (the "Outside Date"), an Officer's Certificate pursuant to each Escrow Agreement, upon which both the Escrow Agent and the Trustee shall conclusively rely, without further investigation or verification, certifying that (i) as of the date of delivery of such Officer's Certificate, there is no Event of Default under clause (5) of the first paragraph under the heading titled "Events of Default" with respect to the Senior Notes Issuer, and (ii) the Acquisition has been consummated or will be consummated reasonably promptly, and in no event later than three Business Days, following the Release, in accordance with the terms of the Acquisition Agreement as in effect on the date of this Offering Memorandum, except for any changes or other modifications to such terms to which the Holders of at least a majority in aggregate principal amount of the Senior Notes then outstanding have consented or that will not, individually or when taken as whole, have a materially adverse effect on the Holders. Under the terms of each Escrow Agreement, the Release shall occur promptly upon the satisfaction of the conditions set forth above (the date of such satisfaction, the "Escrow Release Date"). Upon any such Release, the balance of the Escrow Accounts shall be reduced to zero, and the Escrowed Property shall be released in accordance with each Escrow Agreement. Receipt by the Trustee of such Officer's Certificate shall constitute deemed consent by the Trustee to the release of the Escrowed Property from the charges documented under the Escrow Account Charges. _Special Mandatory Redemption_ Pursuant to one or more shortfall agreements (the "Shortfall Agreements") to be entered into on or prior to the Issue Date between the Issuers and Bellis Midco Limited ("Midco"), a wholly owned subsidiary of Topco and a Holding Company of the Senior Notes Issuer and the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, Midco will be required to contribute to the Escrow Accounts and the corresponding escrow accounts for the Senior Secured Notes, up to the maximum aggregate amount of £20.0 million, an amount in cash expected to equal the sum of (i) interest accrued on the Senior Notes and the Senior Secured Notes from the Issue Date, and (ii) any Additional Amounts or corresponding additional amounts for the Senior Secured Notes, in each case, to March 31, 2021 (the "Shortfall Agreement Termination Date"), which is the date by which we expect to have received the FCA's approval of the Acquisition. A bank of international standing (the "Issuing Bank") will guarantee Midco's obligations under the Shortfall Agreements by delivering to the Senior Notes Issuer and the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, on the Issue Date, an irrevocable letter of credit or on demand guarantee (the "On-Demand Guarantee") expiring on March 31, 2021. Pursuant to the On-Demand Guarantee, each of the Senior Notes Issuer and the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will be entitled to draw funds from the Issuing Bank to make up the relevant escrow shortfall, upon request made no later than March 31, 2021 and up to the maximum aggregate amount of £20.0 million. If the Acquisition and the Release have not occurred by March 31, 2021, Midco shall be entitled to extend the Shortfall Agreement Termination Date unilaterally, at its discretion, by procuring that all of the following actions take place: (a) Midco shall have increased its commitment to contribute cash to the Escrow Accounts and the corresponding escrow accounts for the Senior Secured Notes under the Shortfall Agreements to an amount expected to equal the sum of (i) interest accrued on the Senior Notes and the Senior Secured Notes from April 1, 2021, and (ii) any Additional Amounts or corresponding additional amounts for the Senior Secured Notes, in each case, to a date chosen by Midco that is not later than the Outside Date, (b) the Issuing Bank shall have increased its original commitment under the On-Demand Guarantee by the same amount set forth in clause (a), and (c) the expiry date of the On-Demand Guarantee shall have been extended to, and be the same as, the extended Shortfall Termination Date. The Senior Notes Issuer will promptly deliver notice of any extension of the Shortfall Agreement Termination Date to the Trustee and the Escrow Agent, confirming that all actions described in the preceding clauses (a), (b) and (c) have been completed. Midco may decide to extend the Shortfall Agreement Termination Date on one or more occasions, at its discretion, up to (but no later than) the Outside Date under the Escrow Agreement. The Shortfall Agreements will terminate and be of no further force and effect upon the Release. In the event that (a) the Escrow Release Date does not take place on or prior to the Outside Date, (b) in the reasonable judgment of the Senior Notes Issuer, the Acquisition will not be consummated by the Outside Date, (c) the Acquisition Agreement terminates at any time on or prior to the Outside Date, (d) an 381 ----- Event of Default arises under clause (5) of the first paragraph under "—Events of Default" on or prior to the Outside Date with respect to the Senior Notes Issuer, or (e) the Shortfall Agreement Termination Date occurs on or prior to the Outside Date and at a time when the Escrow Release Date has not yet taken place (the date of any such event being the "Special Termination Date"), the Senior Notes Issuer will redeem all of the Senior Notes (the "Special Mandatory Redemption") at a price equal to 100% of their respective aggregate issue price, plus accrued but unpaid interest from the Issue Date to the Special Mandatory Redemption Date (as defined below) (subject to the right of holders of record on the relevant record date to receive interest due on the relevant interest payment date) and Additional Amounts, if any (the "Special Mandatory Redemption Price"). If a Special Termination Date occurs, notices of the Special Mandatory Redemption will be delivered by the Senior Notes Issuer to the Trustee and the Escrow Agent no later than two Business Days following such date, and these notices will provide that the Senior Notes shall be redeemed on a date that is no later than the fifth Business Day after such notice is given by the Senior Notes Issuer, in accordance with the terms of the Escrow Agreements (the "Special Mandatory Redemption Date"). Provided that the Escrow Accounts are sufficiently funded, on a Special Mandatory Redemption Date, the Escrow Agent shall pay to the Paying Agent for payment to each Holder the Special Mandatory Redemption Price for such Holder's Senior Notes and, substantially concurrently with the payment to such Holders, deliver any excess Escrowed Property to the Senior Notes Issuer.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR NOTES
Subsection Title: General
Subsubsection Text: _The Senior Notes_ The Senior Notes will: - be general senior obligations of the Senior Notes Issuer, secured as set forth under "— _Security";_ - rank pari passu in right of payment with any existing and future Indebtedness of the Senior Notes Issuer that is not expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Senior Notes; - rank senior in right of payment to any future Indebtedness of the Senior Notes Issuer that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Senior Notes; - be effectively subordinated to any existing or future Indebtedness or obligation (including obligations to trade creditors) of the Senior Notes Issuer and its Subsidiaries that is secured by property or assets that do not secure the Senior Notes (including the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility for so long as the Warehouse Assets, Select Retail Assets and Substitute Retail Assets are held by the Senior Notes Issuer or its Subsidiaries, and the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility, for so long as any Forecourt Disposal Receivable is held by the Senior Notes Issuer or its Subsidiaries) or that secure such Indebtedness on a priority basis (including obligations in respect of the Senior Secured Notes, the Senior Credit Facilities, the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility and certain Hedging Obligations), to the extent of the value of the property and assets securing such Indebtedness; - be structurally subordinated to any existing or future Indebtedness of the Subsidiaries of the Senior Notes Issuer that are not Guarantors, including their obligations to trade creditors; and - be guaranteed, on the later of the Issue Date and the Completion Date, on a senior subordinated basis by the Initial Guarantors, and within 90 days of the Completion Date, on a senior subordinated basis by each of McLagan Investments Limited and The Burwood House Group Limited (the "Post-Completion Guarantors" and, together with the Initial Guarantors, the "ASDA Guarantors"), in each case, subject to the Agreed Security Principles and the limitations described herein and in "Risk Factors—Risks Relating to Our Capital Structure, _Our Financing and Our Indebtedness—Each Notes Guarantee and security interest will be subject to certain limitations on enforcement and may be limited by applicable law or subject_ to certain defences that may limit its validity and enforceability"_ and "Certain Insolvency _Considerations and_ _Limitations on Validity and Enforceability of the Notes Guarantees and the Security Interests." The Notes Guarantees_ On the Issue Date, the Senior Notes will be obligations of the Senior Notes Issuer and, on the later of the Issue Date and the Completion Date, will be guaranteed on a senior subordinated basis by the Initial Guarantors, subject to the Agreed Security Principles. Subject to the Agreed Security Principles, the Senior Notes Indenture will require the Senior Notes Issuer to cause the Senior Notes to be guaranteed on a senior subordinated basis by the Post-Completion Guarantors (together with the Initial Guarantors, the 382 ----- "Guarantors") prior to the date falling 90 days after the Completion Date. In addition, if required by the covenant described under "—Certain Covenants—Additional Notes Guarantees," certain other Restricted Subsidiaries may provide a Notes Guarantee in the future. Each Notes Guarantee will: - be a general senior subordinated obligation of the applicable Guarantor; - be subordinated in right of payment to any existing and future senior Indebtedness of the applicable Guarantor, including the Senior Secured Notes or such Guarantor's guarantee of the Senior Secured Notes, as applicable, and Indebtedness Incurred under the Senior Facilities Agreement or the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility; - rank _pari passu in right of payment with any existing and future senior subordinated Indebtedness of that Guarantor; - rank senior in right of payment to any existing or future Indebtedness of the applicable Guarantor that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the applicable Notes Guarantee; - be effectively subordinated to any existing or future Indebtedness or obligation of the applicable Guarantor that is secured by property or assets that do not secure the Notes Guarantee (including the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility for so long as the Warehouse Assets, Select Retail Assets and Substitute Retail Assets are held by the Senior Notes Issuer or its Subsidiaries, and the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility, for so long as any Forecourt Disposal Receivable is held by the Senior Notes Issuer or its Subsidiaries) or that secure such Indebtedness on a priority basis (including obligations in respect of the Senior Secured Notes, the Senior Credit Facilities, the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility and certain Hedging Obligations), to the extent of the value of the property and assets securing such Indebtedness or obligation; - be structurally subordinated to any existing or future Indebtedness or obligation of the Subsidiaries of the applicable Guarantor that are not Guarantors, including their obligations to trade creditors; and - be subject to the limitations described herein and in "Risk Factors—Risks Relating to Our _Capital Structure, Our Financing and Our Indebtedness—Each Notes Guarantee and security interest will be subject to certain limitations on enforcement and may be limited by applicable law or subject to certain defences that may limit its validity and enforceability" and "Certain Insolvency Considerations and_ _Limitations on Validity and Enforceability of the Notes Guarantees and the Security Interests."_ The obligations of the Guarantors will be contractually limited under the applicable Notes Guarantees to reflect limitations under applicable law with respect to maintenance of share capital, corporate benefit, fraudulent conveyance, financial assistance and other legal restrictions applicable to the Guarantors and their respective shareholders, directors and general partners, and as further stipulated in the Agreed Security Principles. For a description of such contractual limitations, see "Certain Insolvency _Considerations and_ _Limitations on Validity and Enforceability of the Notes Guarantees and the Security Interests." By virtue of these limitations, a Guarantor's obligation under its Notes Guarantee could be_ significantly less than amounts payable with respect to the Senior Notes. See also "Risk Factors—Risks _Related to Our Capital Structure, Our Financing and Our Indebtedness—The insolvency laws of England and Wales and other jurisdictions may not be as favourable to you as the_ _U.S. bankruptcy laws and may preclude holders of the Notes from recovering payments due on the Notes." Prior to the CMA Clearance_ Date, the CMA will have broad authority to maintain separation between the ASDA Group and the Bellis Group, which could negatively affect the enforcement of the Notes Guarantees provided by the ASDA Guarantors. See "Risk Factors—Risk Factors Related to the Transactions—The Acquisition is subject to _certain uncertainties and risks, which could adversely impact recoveries under the Notes."_

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR NOTES
Subsection Title: Subordination of the Notes Guarantees on the Basis of the Senior Indenture and the Intercreditor Agreement
Subsubsection Text: Each of the Notes Guarantees is a senior subordinated Notes Guarantee, which means that, pursuant to the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement and the Senior Indenture, each such Notes Guarantee ranks behind, and is expressly subordinated to, all the existing and future Senior Indebtedness of the relevant Guarantor, including any obligations owed by the relevant Guarantor under the Senior Secured Notes, the Senior Credit Facilities, the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility, certain hedging arrangements and any other Indebtedness ranking pari passu therewith incurred after the Issue Date. The ability to take enforcement 383 ----- action against any Guarantor under its Notes Guarantee is subject to significant restrictions imposed by the Intercreditor Agreement, and potentially any Additional Intercreditor Agreement entered into after the Issue Date. In addition, the Notes Guarantees and the Collateral are subject to release under certain circumstances, including, but not limited to, certain enforcement actions taken by the Security Agent acting at the direction of an instructing group of senior secured creditors. Because of the foregoing subordination provisions, it is likely that holders of Senior Indebtedness of a Guarantor would recover disproportionately more than the holders of the Senior Notes in any insolvency proceeding relating to such entity. In any such case, there may be insufficient assets, or no assets, remaining to pay the principal of, or interest on, the Senior Notes after the repayment in full of all Senior Indebtedness. The Notes Guarantees will also be subject to the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, including payment blockage upon a senior default and standstill on enforcement. See "Description of Certain Financing Arrangements—Intercreditor Agreement."

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR NOTES
Subsection Title: Restricted Subsidiaries and Unrestricted Subsidiaries; Extraction of Warehouse Assets, Select Retail Assets, balances credited to Designated Bank Accounts and, to the extent required, Substitute Retail Assets
Subsubsection Text: As of the Issue Date, all of our Subsidiaries will be "Restricted Subsidiaries" for purposes of the Senior Notes Indenture. However, under the circumstances described below under _"—Certain Definitions— _Unrestricted Subsidiary," we will be permitted to designate certain of our Subsidiaries as "Unrestricted_ Subsidiaries." Our Unrestricted Subsidiaries will not be subject to any of the restrictive covenants in the Senior Notes Indenture. On the Completion Date, entities within the ASDA Group entered into the ASDA Leases and granted first-ranking mortgages, fixed charges or standard securities, as applicable, over certain Warehouse Assets and Select Retail Assets and, to the extent required by the terms of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, certain Substitute Retail Assets, as well as first-ranking pledges over the Designated Bank Accounts, in each case, to secure the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower's obligations under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. None of the lenders or the other secured parties under the Senior Secured Bridge Facilities, the Senior Bridge Facility, the Senior Credit Facilities or the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility benefit from any security interest in the Warehouse Assets, the Select Retail Assets, the Substitute Retail Assets or the Designated Bank Accounts, and these assets will not be pledged as collateral for the Senior Secured Notes or the Senior Notes. Following receipt of all regulatory approvals in connection with the Acquisition, the Senior Notes Indenture will allow us to transfer the Warehouse Assets, balances credited to the Designated Bank Accounts and, to the extent required by the terms of the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, the Select Retail Assets and the Substitute Retail Assets to one or more Parents, in exchange for no consideration or for consideration left outstanding in the form of one or more vendor loans. Upon completion of the respective Post-Completion Disposals, the relevant assets will no longer be deemed "Warehouse Assets," "Select Retail Assets" or "Substitute Retail Assets" under the Senior Notes Indenture except in connection with the determination of what property constitutes "Material Real Property" and, in the case of assets that constituted Select Retail Assets or Substitute Retail Assets (as applicable) immediately prior to completion of the relevant Post-Completion Disposal, for purposes of the covenant described under "Certain Covenants—Topco Covenant." Upon the completion of any Retail Assets Contribution, the asset (or related Retail Asset Disposal Proceeds, as applicable) that is the subject of such Retail Assets Contribution will no longer be deemed a "Select Retail Asset" or "Substitute Retail Asset" (as applicable) under the Senior Notes Indenture (other than in connection with the determination of what property constitutes "Material Real Property"). See "Description _of_ _Certain_ _Financing _Arrangements―Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility" for a description of the Distribution Asset_ Disposal Bridge Facility. The Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower intends to repay the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility primarily with the net proceeds from either sales of the Warehouse Assets subject to the ASDA Leases or sale and leaseback transactions involving the Warehouse Assets. Depending on market conditions and expected transaction values, the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility Borrower may also sell subject to the ASDA Leases or sell and lease back some or all of the Select Retail Assets and Substitute Retail Assets, the net proceeds of which will also be applied to repay the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility. The Senior Notes Issuer is required to procure the return, by way of contribution to its equity, Subordinated Shareholder Funding or repayment of Post-Completion Disposal Receivables held by the Senior Notes Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries, of any assets that constituted Select Retail Assets or Substitute Retail Assets at the time of their distribution that are not sold by obligors under the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility (whether by way of sales subject to the ASDA Leases, sale and leaseback transactions or otherwise) and an amount equal to any Net Available Cash from the sale of 384 ----- such assets (including any Retail Asset Disposal Proceeds) that have not been applied to repay or prepay the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility, in each case, promptly after the Distribution Asset Disposal Bridge Facility has been discharged in full. See _"―Certain Covenants―Topco Covenant." For the avoidance of doubt, upon the contribution (including in the form of Subordinated Shareholder Funding) or transfer to the Senior Notes Issuer (or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries, as applicable) pursuant to a Retail Assets Contribution of assets that, at the time of their distribution pursuant to a Post-Completion Disposal, constituted Select Retail Assets or Substitute Retail Assets, such assets will cease to be Select Retail Assets or Substitute Retail Assets (as applicable) and shall be fully subject to the terms of the Senior Notes Indenture, the Senior Notes Indenture, the Senior Facilities Agreement and (if any loans are outstanding under such facility) the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility Agreement, in the same way as any other assets of the Senior Notes Issuer or its Restricted Subsidiaries, except that such assets will remain excluded from the definition of "Material Real Property."

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR NOTES
Subsection Title: Principal and Maturity
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Notes Issuer will issue £500 million in aggregate principal amount of Senior Notes on the Issue Date. The Senior Notes will mature on    , 2027 and will be issued in minimum denominations of £100,000 and in integral multiples of £1,000 in excess thereof.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR NOTES
Subsection Title: Interest
Subsubsection Text: Interest on the Senior Notes will accrue at the rate of % _per annum. Interest on the Senior Notes will: - accrue from the Issue Date or, if interest has already been paid, from the date it was most recently paid; - be payable in cash semi-annually in arrears on and, commencing on   ; - be payable to the holder of record of such Senior Notes on the Business Day immediately preceding the related interest payment date (for Senior Notes held in global form); and - be computed on the basis of actual days elapsed in a 365-day year. The interest amount will be calculated by applying the applicable rate of interest to the aggregate principal amount outstanding under the Senior Notes. Each interest period shall end on (but not include) the relevant payment date. The rights of Holders to receive the payments of interest on the Senior Notes are subject to applicable procedures of Euroclear and Clearstream.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR NOTES
Subsection Title: Methods of Receiving Payments on the Senior Notes
Subsubsection Text: Principal, interest, premium and Additional Amounts, if any, on the Global Senior Notes (as defined below) will be payable at the specified office or agency of one or more Paying Agents; provided that all such payments with respect to the Senior Notes represented by one or more Global Senior Note registered in the name of or held by a nominee of a common depositary for Euroclear and Clearstream, as applicable, will be made by wire transfer of immediately available funds to the account specified by the Holder or Holders thereof. Principal, interest, premium and Additional Amounts if any, on any certificated securities, which shall be in registered form for U.S. federal income tax purposes ("Definitive Registered Notes") will be payable at the specified office or agency of one or more Paying Agents maintained for such purposes. In addition, interest on the Definitive Registered Notes may be paid by bank transfer to the person entitled thereto as shown on the register for the Definitive Registered Notes. See "—Paying Agent, Registrar and Transfer _Agent for the Senior Notes."_ If the due date for any payment in respect of any Senior Notes is not a Business Day at the place at which such payment is due to be paid, the Holder thereof will not be entitled to payment of the amount due until the next succeeding Business Day at such place, and will not be entitled to any further interest or other payment as a result of any such delay.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR NOTES
Subsection Title: Paying Agent, Registrar and Transfer Agent for the Senior Notes
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Notes Issuer will maintain one or more Paying Agents for the Senior Notes. The initial Paying Agent will be Deutsche Bank AG, London Branch (the "Principal Paying Agent" or "Paying Agent"). The Senior Notes Issuer will also maintain a registrar (the "Registrar") and a transfer agent (the "Transfer Agent"). The initial Registrar and Transfer Agent will be Deutsche Bank Luxembourg S.A. The Registrar, Transfer Agent and Paying Agent, as applicable, will maintain a register reflecting ownership of the Definitive Registered Notes outstanding from time to time, if any, and, together with the Transfer Agent, 385 ----- will make payments on and facilitate transfers of the Definitive Registered Notes on behalf of the Senior Notes Issuer. The Senior Notes Issuer may change any Paying Agents, Registrars or Transfer Agents for the Senior Notes without prior notice to the Holders of the Senior Notes. The Senior Notes Issuer or any of its Subsidiaries may act as Paying Agent or Registrar in respect of the Senior Notes.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR NOTES
Subsection Title: Notes Guarantees
Subsubsection Text: On the Issue Date, the Senior Notes will be obligations of the Senior Notes Issuer and, on the later of the Issue Date and the Completion Date, will be guaranteed on a senior subordinated basis by the Initial Guarantors, subject to the Agreed Security Principles. The Senior Notes Indenture will provide that, subject to the Agreed Security Principles, the Senior Notes Issuer will be required to cause the Post-Completion Guarantors to Guarantee the Senior Notes on a senior subordinated basis prior to the date falling 90 days after the Completion Date. As of October 20, 2020, the ASDA Guarantors held title to sites representing 99.9% of the aggregate capital pricing of the ASDA Store and Office Portfolio, as described in "Brokers' _Opinions of Pricing." For the nine month period ended September 30, 2020, the ASDA Guarantors_ represented 99.9% of the Company's consolidated revenue. The obligations of the Guarantors will be contractually limited under the applicable Notes Guarantees to reflect limitations under applicable law with respect to maintenance of share capital, corporate benefit, fraudulent conveyance and other legal restrictions applicable to the Guarantors and their respective shareholders, directors and general partners, and as further stipulated in the Agreed Security Principles. For a description of such contractual limitations, see "Risk Factors—Risks Relating to Our Capital _Structure, Our Financing and Our Indebtedness—The insolvency laws of England and Wales and other jurisdictions may not be as favourable to you as the U.S. bankruptcy laws and may preclude holders of the Notes from recovering payments due on the Notes," "—Each Notes Guarantee and security interest will be subject to certain limitations on enforcement and may be limited by applicable law or subject to certain defences that may limit its validity and enforceability," and "Certain Insolvency Considerations and Limitations on Validity and Enforceability of the Notes Guarantees and the_ _Security Interests."_ The operations of the Senior Notes Issuer are and will be conducted through its Subsidiaries. Claims of creditors of non-Guarantor Subsidiaries, including trade creditors, secured creditors and creditors holding debt and guarantees issued by those Subsidiaries, and claims of preferred and minority stockholders (if any) of those Subsidiaries generally will have priority with respect to the assets and earnings of those Subsidiaries over the claims of creditors of the Senior Notes Issuer and the Guarantors, including Holders of the Senior Notes. The Senior Notes and each Notes Guarantee therefore will be structurally subordinated to creditors (including trade creditors) and preferred and minority stockholders (if any) of Subsidiaries of the Senior Notes Issuer (other than such Subsidiaries that are Guarantors). Although the Senior Notes Indenture limits the Incurrence of Indebtedness by Restricted Subsidiaries, the limitation is subject to a number of significant exceptions. Moreover, the Senior Notes Indenture does not impose any limitation on the Incurrence by Restricted Subsidiaries of liabilities that are not considered Indebtedness under the Senior Notes Indenture. See "—Certain Covenants—Limitation on _Indebtedness" and "—Certain Definitions—Indebtedness." In addition, as described below under "—Certain Covenants—Additional Notes Guarantees" and subject to the Intercreditor Agreement and the Agreed Security Principles, each Restricted Subsidiary that guarantees any Indebtedness Incurred under any Syndicated Term Facilities, any other Credit Facility that provides for aggregate lending commitments in excess of £50.0 million at the relevant date of determination or any Public Debt shall also enter into a supplemental indenture as a Guarantor of the Senior Notes. The Agreed Security Principles apply to the granting of guarantees and security in favour of obligations under the Senior Credit Facilities, the Senior Secured Notes, the Senior Notes and the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility. The Agreed Security Principles include restrictions on the granting of guarantees where, among other things, such grant would be restricted by general statutory or other legal limitations or requirements, financial assistance, corporate benefit, fraudulent preference rules, "thin capitalisation" rules, capital maintenance rules, retention of title claims and similar matters, where the time and cost of granting the guarantee or security would be disproportionate to the benefit accruing to the Holders or where security would be granted over the Capital Stock, liabilities, property or other assets of any member of the Regulated Group. Each Notes Guarantee will be limited to the maximum amount that would not render the Guarantor's obligations subject to avoidance under applicable fraudulent conveyance provisions of the United States Bankruptcy Code or any comparable provision of foreign or state law, or as otherwise stipulated under the Agreed Security Principles, including to comply with corporate benefit, financial assistance and other laws. By virtue of this limitation, a Guarantor's obligation under its Notes Guarantee could be significantly less 386 ----- than amounts payable with respect to the Senior Notes, or a Guarantor may have effectively no obligation under its Notes Guarantee. See "Risk Factors—Risks Relating to Our Capital Structure, Our Financing and _Our Indebtedness—Each Notes Guarantee and security interest will be subject to certain limitations on enforcement and may be limited by applicable law or subject to certain defences that_ _may limit its validity and enforceability," "—The insolvency laws of England and Wales and other jurisdictions may not be as favourable to you as the U.S. bankruptcy laws and may preclude holders of the Notes from recovering payments due on the Notes" and "Certain Insolvency Considerations and_ _Limitations on Validity and Enforceability of the Notes Guarantees and the Security Interests."_ The Notes Guarantee of a Guarantor will terminate and release: (1) upon a sale or other disposition (including by way of consolidation or merger) of the Capital Stock of the relevant Guarantor (whether by direct sale or sale of a holding company) or the sale or disposition of all or substantially all the assets of the Guarantor (other than to the Senior Notes Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary) otherwise permitted by the Senior Notes Indenture; (2) upon the designation in accordance with the Senior Notes Indenture of the Guarantor as an Unrestricted Subsidiary; (3) upon becoming a member of the Regulated Group; (4) upon payment in full of principal, interest and all other obligations on the Senior Notes or upon legal defeasance, covenant defeasance or satisfaction and discharge of the Senior Notes Indenture, as provided in "—Defeasance" and "—Satisfaction and _Discharge";_ (5) with respect to a Guarantor that is not a Significant Subsidiary, so long as no Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, to the extent that such Guarantor (i) is unconditionally released and discharged from its liability with respect to the Senior Credit Facilities and (ii) does not guarantee any Syndicated Term Facility or any other Credit Facility that provides for aggregate lending commitments in excess of £50.0 million at the relevant date of determination or Public Debt; (6) pursuant to the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement (including as described under "Description of Certain Financing _Arrangements—Intercreditor Agreement—Provisions Following an IPO");_ (7) as described under "—Amendments and Waivers"; (8) as described in the first paragraph of the covenant described below under "— _Certain_ _Covenants—Additional Notes Guarantees";_ (9) as a result of a transaction permitted by "—Certain Covenants—Merger and _Consolidation—The Guarantors"; or_ (10) in connection with a Permitted Reorganisation. Upon the request of the Senior Notes Issuer, the Trustee and the Security Agent shall take all reasonably necessary actions, including the granting of releases or waivers under the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement, to effectuate any release of a Notes Guarantee in accordance with these provisions, subject to customary protections and indemnifications. Each of the releases set forth above shall be effected by the Trustee and the Security Agent, as applicable, upon receipt of customary documentation under the Senior Notes Indenture and without the consent of the Holders or any other action or consent on the part of the Trustee or the Security Agent.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR NOTES
Subsection Title: Transfer and Exchange
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Notes will be issued in global registered form without interest coupons, as follows: - Senior Notes sold within the United States to qualified institutional buyers pursuant to Rule 144A under the Securities Act will initially be represented by one or more global notes in registered form without interest coupons attached (the "144A Global Senior Notes"). The 144A Global Senior Notes will, on the Issue Date, be deposited with and registered in the name of the nominee of the common depositary for the accounts of Euroclear and Clearstream. - Senior Notes sold outside the United States pursuant to Regulation S under the Securities Act will initially be represented by one or more global notes in registered form without interest coupons attached (the "Regulation S Global Senior Notes" and, together with the 144A 387 ----- Global Senior Notes, the "Global Senior Notes"). The Regulation S Global Senior Notes will, on the Issue Date, be deposited with and registered in the name of the nominee of the common depositary for the accounts of Euroclear and Clearstream. Ownership of interests in the Global Senior Notes ("Book-Entry Interests") will be limited to persons that have accounts with Euroclear and Clearstream or persons that may hold interests through such participants. Ownership of interests in the Book-Entry Interests and transfers thereof will be subject to the restrictions on transfer and certification requirements summarised below and described more fully under "Notice to _Investors." In addition, transfers of Book-Entry Interests between participants in Euroclear or participants_ in Clearstream will be effected by Euroclear and Clearstream pursuant to customary procedures and subject to the applicable rules and procedures established by Euroclear or Clearstream and their respective participants. Book-Entry Interests in the 144A Global Senior Notes (the "144A Book-Entry Interests") may be transferred to a person who takes delivery in the form of Book-Entry Interests in the Regulation S Global Senior Notes (the "Regulation S Book-Entry Interests") only upon delivery by the transferor of a written certification (in the form provided in the Senior Notes Indenture) to the effect that such transfer is being made in accordance with Regulation S under the Securities Act. Regulation S Book-Entry Interests may be transferred to a person who takes delivery in the form of 144A Book-Entry Interests only upon delivery by the transferor of a written certification (in the form provided in the Senior Notes Indenture) to the effect that such transfer is being made to a person who the transferor reasonably believes is a "qualified institutional buyer" within the meaning of Rule 144A in a transaction meeting the requirements of Rule 144A and in accordance with any applicable state securities laws. Any Book-Entry Interest that is transferred as described in the immediately preceding paragraphs will, upon transfer, cease to be a Book-Entry Interest in the Global Senior Note from which it was transferred and will become a Book-Entry Interest in the Global Senior Note to which it was transferred. Accordingly, from and after such transfer, it will become subject to all transfer restrictions, if any, and other procedures applicable to Book-Entry Interests in the Global Senior Note to which it was transferred. If Definitive Registered Notes are issued, they will be issued only in minimum denominations of £100,000 principal amount and integral multiples of £1,000 in excess thereof upon receipt by the Registrar of instructions relating thereto and any certificates, opinions and other documentation required by the Senior Notes Indenture. It is expected that such instructions will be based upon directions received by Euroclear or Clearstream, as applicable, from the participant that owns the relevant Book-Entry Interests. Definitive Registered Notes issued in exchange for a Book-Entry Interest will, except as set forth in the Senior Notes Indenture or as otherwise determined by the Senior Notes Issuer in compliance with applicable law, be subject to, and will have a legend with respect to, the restrictions on transfer summarised below and described more fully under "Notice to Investors." Subject to the restrictions on transfer referred to above, Senior Notes issued as Definitive Registered Notes may be transferred or exchanged, in whole or in part, in minimum denominations of £100,000 in principal amount and integral multiples of £1,000 in excess thereof. In connection with any such transfer or exchange, the Senior Notes Indenture will require the transferring or exchanging holder to, among other things, furnish appropriate endorsements and transfer documents, to furnish information regarding the account of the transferee at Euroclear or Clearstream, where appropriate, to furnish certain certificates and opinions, and to pay any Taxes in connection with such transfer or exchange. Any such transfer or exchange will be made without charge to the holder, other than any Taxes payable in connection with such transfer. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Registrar and the Transfer Agent are not required to register the transfer or exchange of any Definitive Registered Notes: (1) for a period of 15 days prior to any date fixed for the redemption of Senior Notes; (2) for a period of 15 days immediately prior to the date fixed for selection of Senior Notes to be redeemed in part; (3) for a period of 15 days prior to the record date with respect to any interest payment date (which will be 15 days prior to the relevant interest date for Senior Notes held in definitive registered form); or (4) which the holder has tendered (and not withdrawn) for repurchase in connection with a Change of Control Offer or an Asset Disposition Offer. 388 ----- The Senior Notes Issuer, the Trustee, the Paying Agent, the Transfer Agent and the Registrar will be entitled to treat the Holders of Senior Notes as the owners thereof for all purposes.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE SENIOR NOTES
Subsection Title: Security
Subsubsection Text: _General_ If this Offering is settled prior to, and not substantially concurrently with or after, the Completion Date, the gross proceeds of the offering of the Senior Notes will be deposited into the Escrow Accounts and the Senior Notes will be secured by the Escrow Account Charges on the Issue Date. On the later of the Issue Date and the Completion Date, subject to the Agreed Security Principles, the Senior Notes will be secured by (i) first-priority security interests over (a) the issued share capital of the Senior Notes Issuer (the "Issuer Share Collateral"), (b) the Holdco Proceeds Loan and any other material intercompany receivables owed by the Senior Notes Issuer to its direct Parent, Bellis Midco 4 Limited ("Holdco") and (c) the Senior Notes Issuer's material bank accounts located in England and Wales and (ii) second priority security interests over (a) the issued share capital of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, and (b) the Senior Financing Proceeds Loan and any other material intercompany receivables owing to the Senior Notes Issuer by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer (collectively, the "Collateral"). Subject to certain conditions, including compliance with the covenants described under "—Certain _Covenants—Impairment of Security Interest" and "—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Liens," the Senior_ Notes Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries will be permitted to grant security over the Collateral in connection with future issuances of Indebtedness or Indebtedness of the Restricted Subsidiaries, including any Additional Senior Notes issued by the Senior Notes Issuer as permitted under the Senior Notes Indenture and the Intercreditor Agreement. See "Risk Factors—Risks Relating to Our Capital Structure, _Our Financing and Our Indebtedness."_ Any other security interests that may in the future be granted to secure obligations under the Senior Notes, any Notes Guarantees and the Senior Notes Indenture would also constitute "Collateral." All Collateral will be subject to the operation of the Agreed Security Principles and any Permitted Collateral Liens. The security interests in the issued share capital of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and the Senior Financing Proceeds Loan and any other material intra group receivables owing to the Senior Notes Issuer by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer (together, the "Shared Security") that will secure the Senior Notes on a second priority basis will also secure the Senior Secured Notes and liabilities under the Senior Credit Facilities, including the Revolving Credit Facilities, and the Forecourt Disposal Bridge Facility, as well as certain Hedging Obligations, on a first priority basis, and the Shared Security may also secure certain future indebtedness, including any Additional Senior Secured Notes, on a first priority basis. The proceeds from the enforcement of the Collateral may not be sufficient to satisfy the obligations owed to the holders of the Senior Notes. See "Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Notes Guarantees, the Collateral and the Senior _Notes Collateral—Risks Related to the Senior Notes—The ability of holders of Senior Notes to recover under the pledge of the shares of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and other Shared Security may be limited."_ No appraisals of the Collateral have been made in connection with this Offering of the Senior Notes. By its nature, some or all of the Collateral will be illiquid and may have no readily ascertainable market value. Accordingly, the Collateral may not be able to be sold in a short period of time, or at all. See "Risk Factors— _Risks Related to the Notes Guarantees, the Collateral and the Senior Notes Collateral—Risks Related to the Senior Notes—Claims of the Group's senior secured creditors and, if the Revolving Credit Facilities is designated as a super senior liability in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, claims in respect of any such Super Senior Liabilities will have priority with respect to their security over the claims of Senior Notes holders, to the extent of the value of the assets securing such indebtedness."
